tourName: Amazon and Andes wildlife expedition in Ecuador
generalInfo:
You will be in Lowland Amazon rainforest for almost half of this trip, in an area of south eastern Ecuador, close to the border with Peru. There are no roads into the area, so we will take a private charter flight over a vast horizon of unbroken Amazon forest, landing in indigenous owned lands where oil companies have never been permitted to drill. Here we will switch into a rhythm of life dictated by the Achuar people who live here - learning about their culture, whilst exploring the flora and fauna on foot & over water.

Of Amazon wildlife we can hope to see, monkeys are some of the most visible, ranging from the world's noisiest, the Red Howler Monkey, to the very smallest: the Pygmy Marmoset. Elusive jaguars, puma, tapir, giant river otters, peccary, capybara, agoutis, tamanduas, and more all exist here too; as do Pink River Dolphins, spectacled & black caiman. More than 530 species of bird have been recorded here.

We incorporate an optional overnight Amazon camping adventure and wilderness kayaking in search of wildlife.

Cloud Forest of the Tropical Andes

Several parts of the world are sometimes referred to as the most diverse; but for the record, the Tropical Andes is the most diverse area of our planet. On this trip, we will explore the Western Pacific-facing cloud forest in greatest detail. We will be in an area of incredibly dramatic scenery called the Choco-Andean Rainforest Corridor - an ever-growing conservation area which one of our partner charities, Rainforest Concern, has been one of the most active in creating. The forest is filled with hummingbirds and other avian species. We will make a special effort to see South America's answer to the Bird of Paradise: the Andean Cock-of-the-Rock; sitting in wait at leks where the bright red-orange males perform elaborate mating displays

Choco-Andean Rainforest Concern Conservation Corridor Ecuador

Of mammals, we might be lucky enough to see evidence of Spectacled Bears, Tayra and the world's most recently discovered mammal: the Olinguito.

Cloud forest gives rise to an explosion of flora, including orchids, moss-laden trees and carboniferous tree ferns. Walking along the edges of the Andes, we will find the forest canopy above and beneath us; and spread spectacularly across mountains and deep valleys to the horizon. The volume of life encapsulated within a single view is breath-taking.

Avenue of Volcanoes

Between Quito, the Amazon and Choco-Andean cloud forest, we will travel through and stay in the alto plano (high plains), dwarfed by the highest volcanic peaks in the world. How many peaks we see will depend upon cloud cover, but here are some of the volcanoes we will pass will be:

Cotopaxi Volcano - Ecuador's second highest mountain reaching 5,897m

Chimborazo - now dormant, is Ecuador's highest peak at 6,263m

Antisana Volcano

Tungurahua Volcano

dayInfo.description: You will be collected from Quito airport, or anywhere else you need within the city. You will then be transferred to a lovely boutique hotel in a premium part of the city where the group will meet, take a gourmet three course dinner and receive an introduction about the journey ahead from trip host, Ralph. Ralph is a director of our company and worked 5 years at partner charity, Rainforest Concern.

After breakfast, we will set out south from Quito along the Avenue of Volcanoes. Our road will ply Ecuador's alto plano (high plains), out of which literally erupt some of the Andes highest volcanoes. If cloud cover is favourable, we can hope to see Cotopaxi, Chimborazo and Tungurahua. If we do, we will certainly stop to admire. From the alto plano we will descend the eastern slopes of the Andes and stop at a traditional farm for some local foods and to take a look at ancient weaving still taking place in the area. From this, the Salasaca area, we will drive to the a place on Amazon tributary, the Rio Pastaza, where the smaller Rio Verde joins it at a dramatic waterfall. From here we will continue past Puyo, on the edge of the Amazon Basin. We will stay in a small hotel with lovely gardens and some great local food knocked up by our host Sofia.

After breakfast, we will drive about 10 minutes to an air strip from where we will take a private plane into a remote part of the Amazon, not far from the border with Peru. Please Note: in going to such as remote part of the Amazon, we are at the mercy of the elements. If there is excessive rain then we will have to delay until the skies are sufficiently clear ro fly. We might be delayed both in flying to the Amazon and in getting back - by as much as 24 hours. We will have to adapt if this is the case. Once we do take off, we will fly 160 km and 50 minutes Amazon as pristine as it should be. The wide meandering Rio Pastaza will be seen beneath us, with tributaries of all sizes feeding black waters into those delivered laden with material carried down from the Andes. Once we land, we will meet with our Achuar hosts, boarding a motor canoe which will carry us 20 minutes to our lodge. We will settle in and take lunch, after which we will head out on a walk which will first describe the local ecology; and then quieten down as we seek out wildlife. Cicadas and Screaming Piha birds will become familiar daytime sounds. When Red Howler Monkeys begin to sing, we will know that darkness isn't far away - something which descends quickly on the Equator. After dinner, we will get to know our Achuar hosts - a chance to share thoughts about your visit, the Amazon and wider world.

Achuar culture and beliefs are based around dreams and visions. The Achuar begin each day early, 3 - 4am, drinking wayus tea. Wayus is from a native plant, Ilex guayusa, which is part of the Holly genus - high in caffeine with positive antioxidant properties. The Achuar drink wayus early in the morning, whilst sharing their dreams - something you can join them for this morning. As daylight begins to appear, we will head out onto the Rio Pastaza, in search of macaws, parrots and other birds which sometimes descend en masse onto a section of river bank to top up on minerals. Dawn is one of the most active times of the day for wildlife, so we will be sure to make use of opportunities first thing each day in the Amazon. We will have breakfast at around 8am, before heading out to an Achuar village to learn about local medicinal plants. There is plenty of insect noise during the middle of the day, but less potential for mammals. You are also likely to feel somewhat tired by this time, so lunch with a rest afterwards is likely to be welcome. You will be able to walk in the near vicinity and gaze at the river too - if you are lucky, perhaps making sight of pink river dolphins. Mid-afternoon, we will head out in search of wildlife again on the river. You can remain in a slow motor canoe, or propel yourself by kayak. After dinner, we will head out on a night walk in search of all things great and small. We will conduct further night walks, so if you are tired after an early start, you might prefer to explore by night on a later occasion.

If you wish, you can partake in wayus early morning again. We will then go in search of birds and monkeys along a tributary to the Rio Pastaza. Breakfast will be at 8am, after which we will take time to learn more about Achuar culture, beliefs and how they are dealing with challenges posed by the modern world. Achuar land rights are such that the Ecuadorian Government does not own rights it can sell to prospectors for oil and minerals. Thus far, the Achuar have refused access to oil and mining. They have had the opportunity to see some of the damage these activities have inflicted on areas to the north and south and prefer to develop through ecotourism and other means. The following plan can be adapted for you if you prefer not to camp overnight on a raised platform, deep in Amazon wilderness. After lunch, we will get into a motor canoe and head to our camping area, set up and take an early dinner. We will then head out in search of wildlife, returning just before dark.
Early morning we will explore by motor or canoe, heading back to the lodge in time for a late lunch. Mid-afternoon we will head out again in search of wildlife.

Wayus and dream sharing is an option again before Dawn. As light emerges, we will head out in search of wildlife and birdlife, either on foot on water. After breakfast, we will head to the air strip and fly back to where we can reconnect to the outside world. Note: once again, weather can cause delays in our flight. We will only fly when it is safe to do so. After flying almost an hour over Amazon wilderness, we will head by road north up into the Andes, to an area of thermally heated springs at Papallacta. Here we will stay at a hotel and spa with views (subject to cloud cover) of the glacial peaks of Antisana Volcano. Here you can relax as you wish, at the highest altitude you will have reached so far, sleeping at 3,500 meters above sea level. There are nature trails close by and spa treatments are available. Breakfast and lunch are included today, but dinner will be by your own account.

After breakfast, departing at 9.30am, we will drive from the eastern side of the Andes to cloud forests on the western Pacific-facing slopes of the Andes. We will be in the the Choco region. The drive will take about 3 ½ hours, delivering us to a river which flows down from the Choco-Andean Rainforest Corridor. From here, we will pack your bags onto mules whilst we walk about 2 hours uphill to a community owned lodge. We will go at a slow pace, watching for birdlife as we go. The temperature will reduce as we walk; the sound of insects will subside; and the types of plant around you will change. Your views will also become ever more impressive as you gaze over some of the best preserved cloud forests of western Ecuador. You will be able to settle into your room before lunch and a briefing about the area. This is one of the main locations that trip leader, Ralph, used to work for Rainforest Concern. Either side of lunch, it's worth gazing at the views and stopping to observe and photograph dozens of hummingbirds. In the afternoon we will go for a walk, soaking up views; looking for evidence of mammals such as Tayra and Spectacled Bears; and looking in detail at the huge variety of flora which surrounds us.

Very early morning, we will trek to a 'lek' where we will try to watch bright orange / red male Cock of the Rock birds perform to females. We can enjoy lots more birdlife, scenery and potentially mammals, this morning and throughout the rest of the day. Depending upon cloud cover (which changes quickly through the day), you may be able to enjoy far reaching views of the Choco-Andean Rainforest Corridor. Ralph will take you to a reforestation sites and explain the status of different parts of Corridor.

We will enjoy walking at dawn before taking breakfast. You can then pack your bags to be loaded onto mules, whilst we take a long meandering walk from around 1,800m eleveation down to 1,200m. This is where we will meet our vehicle and head back to Quito. Overnight in the hotel you stayed in on Day 1.

generalInfo:
Designed for those seeking ultimate nature and adventure, this two-week itinerary immerses you in Ecuador’s most untamed landscapes home to Indigenous communities and staggering biodiversity. Begin deep in the Ecuadorian Amazon exploring Yasuni National Park, then island-hop through the Galapagos Islands with expert local guides who reveal the archipelago’s history, culture, and extraordinary wildlife.

Throughout your trip, you’ll travel responsibly, travel differently, and stay in eco-lodges that support local communities and conservation efforts.

dayInfo.description: Quito: Upon arrival, transfer to your airport hotel and spend the evening at leisure, settling in and preparing for the adventure ahead.

Ecuadorian Amazon: Rise early for your flight to the jungle town of Coca, where your Amazon adventure begins. Travel by canoe along the winding waterways of Yasuni National Park before arriving at your unique jungle lodge. Over the coming days discover the incredible biodiversity of the Amazon as you explore its jungle trails, climb observation towers, and navigate serene creeks in a traditional dugout canoe. Witness the spectacle of vibrant parrot clay licks and connect with the local culture at the Kichwa Interpretation Centre, managed by the women of the community.

Quito: Return to Quito and settle into your boutique hotel in the heart of the city’s historic centre. With your local guide, explore the old town’s cobblestone streets, whitewashed walls, and elaborately decorated churches before ending with a chocolate workshop where you will learn about the Cacao process from bean to bar. The next day, choose from three private full-day tours: visit the vibrant indigenous markets of Otavalo, explore the iconic Cotopaxi Volcano, or wander the mist-shrouded Bellavista Cloud Forest. Whatever you choose, enjoy a glimpse into the richness of Ecuador’s landscapes and local traditions.

Santa Cruz Island: Fly to the Galapagos Islands where the next seven days promise an immersive island-hopping adventure. Kayak, snorkel, or paddleboard along the turquoise waters of the Itabaca Channel and encounter iconic wildlife, from blue-footed boobies and sea lions to brown pelicans and white-tipped reef sharks. Continue to the highlands of Santa Cruz to observe Giant Tortoises roaming freely in their natural habitat. The following day, head out to sea with a Galapagueno fisherman turned naturalist guide and explore Santa Fe Island. Here, you’ll have the chance to swim with sharks, snorkel among colourful fish, and walk alongside one of the most important sealion colonies in the entire reserve.

Floreana Island: Transfer by shared speed boat to Floreana Island, the first inhabited island of the archipelago and a former pirate’s lair. A stay here, not only brings you close to the islands unique wildlife but also offers the privilege to connect with local residents like Claudio Cruz whose deep knowledge of Floreana’s history, provides a rare insight into daily life on Floreana. During your stay, walk or kayak to Black Beach for snorkelling, visit the sea lion breeding grounds of La Loberia and explore the highlands aboard a local chiva (open airbus) as your local guide shares stories of Floreana’s colourful past and rural present.

Isabela Island: Conclude your Galapagos adventure on Isabela, one of the youngest’s and most volcanically active islands. Visit the local giant tortoise breeding centre, an essential conservation project, and cycle along the islands network trails where you’ll encounter marine iguanas, giant tortoises, and the historic Wall of Tears. Explore the Tintoreras islets in search of sharks, sea lions, turtles, rays, penguins, and blue footed boobies, then snorkel in a sheltered bay often accompanied by playful penguins and sealions. Hike to the crater rim of the gigantic Sierra Negra Volcano for incredible views before continuing to Volcan Chico to explore its otherworldly lava fields, tubes, and fumaroles.
Departure: Say goodbye to the Galapagos and fly back to mainland Ecuador, connecting with your international flight home.

tourName: Amazon Rainforest luxury wildlife lodge, Ecuador
generalInfo:
Join the adventure: an 8-day journey through two of Ecuador’s four vibrant regions. This is an experience that blends culture and adventure into one unforgettable trip.

Your journey begins in the heart of Quito, where its historic center welcomes you with open arms. Luxury will be your constant companion, while visual, auditory, and culinary pleasures shape truly unique moments. The streets, monuments, statues, and people will leave a lasting mark on your journey, thanks to the warm hospitality present in every detail.

Daily encounters with locals will bring an authentic touch to your experience, and the traditional activities of Quito will awaken all your senses—each day bringing you closer to your grand adventure in Ecuador’s living lungs: the Amazon.

As the days go by, the call of the wild grows louder. After your time in the vibrant city, your itinerary will lead you deep into the Amazon Rainforest, where you’ll connect with the Kichwa culture and its people. You’ll witness unique flora, and at night, the presence of the jungle's wildlife will surround you with its sounds and mystery.

Your heart will begin to beat in sync with nature, while you remain connected to the comforts and pleasures of luxury. By the end of this journey, you’ll leave as a new person—forever carrying a piece of Ecuador in your heart.

dayInfo.description: Arrive at Quito, Ecuador’s capital nestled in the Andes. Your guide will transfer you to the luxurious ILLA Experience Hotel where every moment transcends the present, and is deeply connected with your journey. The colonial facade will welcome you to your evening. Every detail will be carefully taken care of by the attentive staff. Discover the colonial charm in the city. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site because of its preserved architecture, churches, and museums.

Quito Six Senses City Tour & Equator Tour. Visit the historic center of Quito, including Independence Square, colonial-era streets, and traditional artisans' workshops. Continue to the Equatorial Line Complex to be on both hemispheres simultaneously. Meals Included: Breakfast
The Napo Wildlife Center. Fly to Coca, then take a boat down the Napo River. Enjoy a sunset paddle tour along the Napo River, while spotting wildlife. Meals Included: Breakfast / Lunch /Dinner

Canopy Tower & Napo Wildlife Center. Enjoy a Kichwa traditional experience before ascending a canopy tower to enjoy panoramic views and bird-watching. Enjoy guided walks in the rainforest and paddle through Anangu Creek. Meals Included: Breakfast / Lunch /Dinner

Parrot Clay Lick & Kichwa Community. See hundreds of parrots eating minerals at Ecuador's best clay lick for parrots. Visit the Kuri-Muyu Interpretation Center and learn about Kichwa tradition. You can also take part in a cultural celebration. Meals Included: Breakfast / Lunch /Dinner

Wildlife Exploration & Farewell Trek the Tiputini trail to see unique Amazonian wildlife. The lodge is the final stop for wildlife encounters on your way back to Quito. Meals Included: Breakfast / Lunch /Dinner
Quito depart. End your Amazon adventure by transferring to the airport. Meals Included: Breakfast

generalInfo:
Ecuador is well known as a wildlife destination, with habitats such as the Amazon, Cloud Forest and of course the Galapagos Islands there is something for every wildlife enthusiast in Ecuador. However one habitat that is often overlooked are the high altitude grasslands and forests of the Andes. This tour explores these ecosystems in search of a wealth of rare and elusive species.

Introduction:
We are specialists in tailoring wildlife watching all over the world and we have a great range of South American wildlife watching safari holidays, including various options for Ecuador. But unlike many Ecuadorean wildlife holidays this one doesn't focus on birdlife or the Galapagos (extensions for birding, Amazon or Galapagos are all available in request) but instead focuses on mammals and in particular mammals of the Andean mountains.

The major targets for this trip are two of South America's largest mammals, the enigmatic Andean (or spectacled) bear and the very rare mountain tapir. These inhabitants are often seen in the paramo (grasslands) at the higher altitudes of the Andes. In this relatively sparse ecosystem there is a huge amount of life and with good local guides, perseverance, specialist equipment (including thermal imaging scopes) we hope to find animals such as Andean fox, northern pudu, colocolo, Andean rabbits etc.

This trip also heads into the slightly lower down cloud forests which fringe the valleys around the paramo grasslands. Here we look for specialist species which inhabit only this narrow strip of habitat such as olinguito, Andean white-eared opossum, mountain coati as well as other species such as northern oncilla, kinkajou and tayra.

All in all we believe this is a unique tour, a trip that will delight anyone wishing to see some of the world's rarest and most elusive species of mammals.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner) where mentioned, in some locations lunch and dinner are not included (please refer to the itinerary), such as in Quito. There will be bottled water (approx 1ltr) available for each guest each day. We have our own private air conditioned vehicles with an excellent driver for all transfers. Where possible we use two brilliant guides; first a professional zoologist (when available - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us) who will escort you on all your excursions and we also have very knowledgeable English speaking local naturalist guides who have decades of experience working and guiding through Ecuador and particularly the Andean and cloud forest habitats. Your naturalist escort is an expert in mammals and their conservation and behaviour and will be able to help you identify the different species as well as interpret you what behaviours you are seeing. We also bring some specialist equipment such as high powered telescopes, thermal imaging scopes and sound equipment which all give us chances to see rare species.

The local guides have spent years searching out the best wildlife watching locations and have an unrivalled knowledge where we are going to visit. Where needed we further employ local guides at specific locations where their intimate knowledge of individual reserves and parks is invaluable in finding our targeted species. We also include all vehicle safaris, river safaris, spotlighting, guided walks, park entrance fees and sightseeing entrance fees. We include more time spent in the field searching for wildlife per day than any other tour operator around; only if you request to have a rest day will we not arrange a safari into the park. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide - zoologists are not always available, if you wish to have a zoologist escort your trip, please inquire with us).

Seasons:

We recommend the shoulder seasons of the cold winter (wet) season and the hotter drier (dry) season. So we recommend (and run group tours) in February and then again in November annually.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced naturalist as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• Our local Ecuadorean guides have a good relationship with the park officials and local guides because of this we get a heads up when animals are sighted and this can guide us in where to focus and thus increasing our chances of seeing our targeted species.
• We have special access to lodges and resorts where wildlife can be seen, we do not have to be staying at these lodges, our expert guides have good relationships with the management and so we can visit many places for different wildlife.
• Visit the park morning and afternoon as well as having the chance to stay inside the park for nocturnal drives and spotlighting for nocturnal mammals.
• All the above reasons give this, our wildlife and mammal watching tours of Ecuador a great success rate of seeing the best wildlife around here. We have an unrivalled network of experts and guides throughout South America so that we can try and find and observe animals such as the Andean bears, mountain tapirs, Northern pudus, Northern oncillas, Olinguitos and many more species. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Ecuador at other times of year and focusing on other species such as hummingbirds, Amazonian species and of course the Galapagos Islands and many species throughout this incredible country. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

The entrance and exit point of this trip is Quito and we do not necessarily travel very far from the capital as we head into the Andes and cloud forests. Our main areas are Bellavist and Caymabe-Coca National Park.

Fitness Level:

The vast majority of wildlife watching is all done from a vehicle. There is some hiking, however in general the hiking is easy (unless you choose to hike longer trails in Bellavista - which is hilly) and usually around 200-300m away from the vehicle. So no physical fitness for hiking or anything like that is needed. This is a very easy trip to undertake.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking.

Minimum Age: 15 Years Old

Alex Popovkin, Bahia, Brazil from Brazil, via Wikimedia Commons

dayInfo.description: Quito / Bellavista - We recommend everyone arrives in the morning today, if you cannot find a morning flight on this day we recommend arriving the night before (we can recommend and book local hotels in Quito for you). We will collect everyone from the airport or hotels in Quito this morning and then drive the couple of hours or so to the western slope of the Andes and the wonderful little private reserve of Bellavista. After checking in we will hike around some of their trails, most of the species we will be looking for here are nocturnal or at least crepuscular but we will try and find red-tailed squirrels and maybe a western mountain coati foraging around. But once the sun begins to fall behind the trees and hills the mammals start to come out, we will then spend time at the banana feeding station. It is here that they regularly get visits from kinakajous, Andean white-eared opossums and of course the olinguito. It is around here that during the early mornings you can also sometimes see tayra and western mountain coati. Then after dinner we will hit the road for some spotlighting around the winding mountain roads surrounding the lodge. (Dinner only today)

Papallacta - This morning will be our last pre-dawn drive and then after breakfast we will depart Bellavista and travel back to Quito. We do not spend long in the city and quickly drive out and towards the Antisana volcano in Cayambe-Coca National Park. The drive will take 3 hours or so and along the way, once we are in the paramo and out of the city, we will stop and scan for bears. There are several bear territories along the highway and we will be looking for the tell-tale signs of bear activity. Our local guide is very knowledgeable about the bears and where they like to forage and with his help we will hopefully see a bear before even getting to our lodge today. After arriving in Pamballacta we will check in and then (depending on the time) drive in the afternoon up into the paramo and once again scanning for bears as well as mountain tapir. Also around here and possible are Andean rabbits, Andean fox, Andean white-tailed deer and northern pudu. Some are easier to see than others, but we will spend time looking for each species. Then after dinner back at the lodge we know a location nearby where the little understood stump-tailed porcupine is known from. (breakfast and dinner only)

Quito / Home - This morning we will depart after breakfast and travel back to the capital and to the airport in time to catch your return flight home. If you cannot get flights for today we can of course arrange a hotel in Quito for you and drop you there instead.

tourName: Classic Galapagos island hopping tour, tailor made
placesVisited: San Cristobal, Kicker Rock, Santa Cruz, Charles Darwin Research Station, Highlands excursion, Giant Galapagos Tortoises, Isabela, Flamingo Lagoon, Sierra Negra Volcano trek, Concha Perla, Los Tuneles, Kayaking in bay of Puerto Villamil
generalInfo:
Perhaps the world's foremost destination for wildlife watching, and the inspiration behind Charles Darwin's Theory of Evolution, the Galapagos Islands are an awe-inspiring archipelago of biodiversity. On these isolated isles you'll discover plant and animal species that simply don't exist anywhere else, some as uninhabited as the day the Beagle first weighed anchor here.

On this eight day, island-hopping tour of the Galapagos, we visit three of the main islands, San Cristobal, Santa Cruz and Isabela, travelling between them using speedboat transfers and staying in comfort class hotels.

Our tour begins on the island of San Christobal, where you will have free time to visit the Interpretation Centre or enjoy some sun on the beautiful Playa Mann beach if you like. We'll spend a whole day snorkeling and exploring the stunning marine life around Kicker Rock, where sharks and rays swim, before continuing on to the island of Santa Cruz. And it's here, on the Santa Cruz Highlands, that you'll meet the famous Giant Galapagos Tortoises.

We then transfer to Isabela island, where we visit the colourful residents of the Flamingo Lagoon. Isabela is also the site of Los Tuneles, a sea sanctuary considered as one of the world's best spots for snorkeling. Lava flows have produced unique geological formations creating the ideal habitat for a wide variety of marine species. We'll also enjoy a kayak excursion of Puerto Villamil Bay.

dayInfo.description: Quito – San Cristobal – Free Afternoon: Our English speaking guide will be waiting for you at the San Cristobal airport. If you arrive before 02:00 PM you will get lunch. If you arrive later, lunch is not included. This day will be self-guided. Optional activities: You can visit The San Cristobal Interpretation Center, where you will learn about the islands, evolution of their species, fauna, migration, and how humans came to live here. Then you can go to Playa Mann for your first contact with the stunning waters of these islands. Accommodation in Hotel Casa Opuntia or similar. Lunch included.

Kicker Rock: After breakfast, you go by boat to snorkel at Kicker Rock, one of the most spectacular landmarks in the Galapagos Islands. Two volcanic rocks of 140 meters tall, located off the coast of San Cristobal Island. Viewed from the south, the rocks look like a sleeping lion, which is why the Spanish name is León Dormido (sleeping lion). From another side it looks like a boot, hence the English name: Kicker Rock. This tiny island is the favorite place for an array of marine birds and great underwater life. The natural erosion of this ancient cone has created a channel between the rocks that provides the ideal habitat to a variety of sharks and rays. In the afternoon, you go back to the hotel. Accommodation in Hotel Casa Opuntia or similar. Breakfast and lunch included.

Free Morning – Puerto Ayora: You have the morning for yourself where you can visit Playa Mann, La Loberia or just to relax in your hotel. At 14:00 PM, you take the public speedboat to Puerto Ayora (about 2,5 hours). Upon arrival you will be taken to your hotel. Accommodation in Hotel Fiesta or similar. Breakfast included.

Bartolome, Plazas, Floreana, or North Seymour: Today you go on a full day tour by speedboat to one of the uninhabited islands Bartolome, Plazas, Floreana or North Seymour. All the trips include some snorkeling and hiking. The chosen island depend on availability and National Park regulations. You can let us know your preference. Accommodation in Hotel Fiesta or similar. Breakfast and box lunch included.

Santa Cruz Island Highlands – Isabela Island: In the morning you will go to the Highlands of Santa Cruz to make closer contact with the Giant Galapagos Tortoises in their natural habitat. You will be surrounded all the excursion by the endemic vegetation of the Galapagos. Around 1:30 PM, you will take a public speedboat to Isabela Island, which takes approximately 2,5 hours. Upon arrival in Isabela, you will be taken to your beach front hotel. You can walk around or visit by yourself the Flamingo Lagoon (10 min walking). This place is the largest coastal lagoon found in the Galapagos and is one of the main reproductive sites for the majority of flamingos. Accommodation in Hotel Albemarle or similar. Breakfast included.

Los Tuneles: After breakfast, your guide will take you to what is said to be one of the best snorkeling places in the world, Los Tuneles. The water is shallow, calm and very clear- a sea sanctuary. A series of lava flows have produced unique geological formations, a series of arcs and tunnels underneath and above the water- a habitat for many local Galapagos Species. The entrance to the site is shallow and the waves can be strong, for this reason, the access can be complicated. You will have a snack on board and then return to Puerto Villamil. Accommodation in Hotel Albemarle or similar. Breakfast and snack included.

Kayak in Puerto Villamil - Free Afternoon: After breakfast the guide will accompany you for a kayak excursion in the bay of Puerto Villamil. The afternoon you have time to enjoy the beautiful beach or to do another optional activity. Accommodation in Hotel Albemarle or similar. Breakfast included.
Flight to Baltra Airport: After breakfast you take a flight from Isabela airport to Baltra airport (about 45 minutes). Your tour ends on Baltra Airport. Breakfast included. End of services.

placesVisited: Quito, Río Toachi, El Monte’s Cloud Forest reserve, Antisana Ecological Reserve, La Mica Lake, Pasochoa Volcano Wildlife Reserve, Quilotoa Crater Lake, Activities can include: mountain biking, jungle trekking, white water rafting, horse riding, cultural and history tours and wildlife watching
generalInfo:
This tailor made week in Ecuador is ideal for families, school parties and adventurous friends who are looking to get outdoors and active within an amazing array of exhilarating environments.

Although Ecuador is relatively small it still packs one heck of a punch in terms of variety with numerous volcanic landscapes providing an absolute playground for adventure activities, such as mountain biking in Cotopaxi National Park and rafting on the Toachi and Blanco rivers

As this suggested holiday itinerary can be tailor made all year round, you get to pick a time of year that fits in with your plans as well as deciding upon which activities and which level of exertion best suits your expectations.

Starting in Quito you’ll be invited to discover Ecuador’s Spanish colonial heritage and ecclesiastical architecture prior to heading out into the countryside where cultural contrasts within highland farming villages ensure you get to see all sides of Ecuador against some lusciously fertile volcanic landscapes.

Forget the South American heavyweights and expensive offshore alternatives, an activity holiday in Ecuador is all set to be one of the next big things, just make sure you keep it under your toquilla straw hat.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Quito. Transfer to hotel. Free day. You will be met on arrival at the airport and transferred to your hotel. The day is yours to explore Quito and to adapt to the altitude (2,800m). Make sure you visit the beautiful Old Town with it’s many squares and churches – head to Independence Square, where the Presidential Palace, the Cathedral and El Sagrario Church are located. Later on maybe visit the Church of La Compañía (1605), with its amazing gilt altars (considered the finest example of baroque art in America), or see the Monastery of San Francisco (1535) - the oldest Ecuadorian church and the main altar inside is a spectacular example of baroque carving. For a spectacular view of Quito take a taxi ride to the highest viewpoint of the city, “ El Panecillo” where you can see the only winged virgin in South America.

Depart Quito at 7am for a 3-hour journey north west of Quito down the outer slopes of the Andes through beautiful cloud forest to the shores of the river. The Río Toachi is a fantastic introduction to the rivers of Ecuador. Flowing off the coastal side of the Andes it has some of the longest navigable sections of white-water in the country. Combine this with the sights and sounds of the forest environment we pass through and you are guaranteed a day to remember. Before setting off on our rafting experience you will be fitted with life jackets and helmets, given a comprehensive safety briefing and be trained in the paddling techniques needed to navigate your way down the river. The rafting activity takes around 3 hours. During the trip we’ll stop by the side of the river for a delicious picnic lunch. At the end of the day you will be dropped off in the local town of Mindo. Overnight in El Monte Lodge, Mindo with 3 meals included.

This morning enjoy an early hike through El Monte’s cloud forest reserve with a local guide. The area of Mindo in Ecuador is famous for its diverse birdlife. Then take part in the exhilarating canopy activity at the near-by zip lining centre, where there are 10 different zip lines ranging from 20 to 400 metres in length, taking you on a thrilling ride over the canopy of the beautiful cloud forest. After lunch back at El Monte Lodge you will be picked up by your driver for your return journey to Quito. En route you will have the opportunity to visit the Mitad del Mundo where the equator line crosses Ecuador. A great photo opportunity. Overnight in Quito (B,L)

This morning you depart Quito at 7am and head towards the Antisana Ecological Reserve. The stunning snow-capped Antisana Volcano is Ecuador’s fourth highest and is one of the best places in Ecuador for spotting the endangered Andean Condor. The mountain biking activity begins at La Mica Lake (4000m) located within the ecological reserve. Our route of around 30km brings us through the beautiful Andean paramos of this region. The first 7km of the ride are mainly flat before a 2km climb up to the mountain pass. From here we can enjoy a fantastic downhill ride through the changing Andean landscapes before arriving at the entrance to the park, where the ride ends. Box lunch is served en-route and there is a back up vehicle with the group at all times. In the afternoon return to Quito and the hotel (B,L)

This morning you will be picked up at 8am from your hotel and head south for one hour to the beginning of the Avenue of the Volcanoes. Our hike takes us on a trail which ascends through the Pasochoa Volcano Wildlife Reserve, walking through Andean forests, up to the ridge of the old cadera. We discover the fascinating flora and fauna of this reserve and picnic with incredible 360 degree views of the Pasochoa, Atacaso & Corazon volcanoes. In the afternoon we continue our journey south onto the Quilotoa region. Overnight Hacienda La Cienega (B,L,D)

This morning we drive to Quilotoa Crater lake from where we begin today's walk. We follow the rim of this stunning lagoon with its incredible blue-green waters, one of Ecuador’s most beautiful and impressive spots. Box lunch included. In the afternoon we return to Quito and our hotel (B,L)
Private transfer from your hotel to the airport for your onward flight. (B)

placesVisited: Quito, Otavalo, Cuicocha Lagoon, Cotacachi, Papallacta, Archidona, Arajuno River, Quichua Community visit by canoe, Misahualli, Puyo, Macas, Shuar Waterfall, Lagoons of Atillo, Guamote, Andean Kichwa Community, Riobamba, Chimborazo Volcano, Latacunga, La Victoria, Zumbahua, Quilotoa Lagoon, Chugchilan, Hacienda La Cienega, Cotopaxi National Park
generalInfo:
Mainland Ecuador remains practically unknown to most people, and this beautifully woven two week tour will reveal its myriad beguilements. This diverse land mingles wildlife-thronged forests with snow-clad volcanoes, tropical vegetation, richly storied colonial cities and tribal villages hidden in the jungle. It's a perfect tour for travellers keen to discover one of South America’s hidden gems – with the option to extend the trip to the celebrated Galapagos Islands.

You'll enjoy countless encounters with volcanoes – including Ecuador's highest peak, whose summit is the furthest point on Earth from its core, and the shores of the gorgeous volcano lake at Quilotoa. There will be an opportunity to hike through Ecuador's rainforests and highlands as well as the chance to take an unforgettable Andean train ride from Ibarra to Salinas and over the fabled Devil’s Nose.

Nature lovers will also savour encounters with iconic Ecuadorean wildlife including the Andean Humming Bird, the Cara Cara and the majestic Andean Condor – plus, of course, llamas and guinea pigs!

Contrast the urban buzz and major historic sights of Quito with the tiny jungle town of Macas and the traditional ceramics manufacturing village of La Victoria.

The trip ends with time at Cotopaxi National Park where you can take a walk around Limpiopungo Lagoon and soak up the stunning views from Tambopaxi mountain refuge before finally returning to Quito from where you'll begin your journey home.

dayInfo.description: Arrival in Quito (approx. 1 hr driving) Arrive in Quito and transfer to the hotel. Depending on your time of arrival, you may have time to explore the city. Overnight Patio Andaluz or similar. No meals are included today.

Quito – Cotacachi (approx. 3hrs driving) This morning explore the colonial old town of Quito (UNESCO World Heritage Site). Visit the major colonial churches and monasteries including La Catedral, El Sagrario, La Compañia and San Francisco. Later, visit Independence Plaza flanked by the Cathedral, the Presidential Palace, the Municipal Building and the Archbishop’s Palace. Continue to the Church of San Francisco, one of the greatest religious buildings in South America. Its impressive façade and atrium lead to an opulent gold interior, a Baroque influence with the winged Virgin of Quito at its main altar. Visit the historic colonial quarter of Quito, resplendent with its churches, gilded altars and religious sculptures and paintings dating from the 17th 18th and 19th centuries. The tour continues through narrow streets, ancient colonial houses with Moorish-style arches and mysterious patios to El Panecillo, a vantage point for a stunning view of the city. This afternoon, drive from Quito north to Mitad del Mundo (literally middle of the world) where the Equatorial Line Monument is located. Here you can stand with one foot in the Northern, and one in the Southern hemisphere. Leaving Quito behind, continue to Cotacachi where you are welcomed by a local family. Overnight at Runa Tupari or similar (BLD)

Cuicocha Lagoon (approx. 2hrs driving) Today we explore the surroundings of the Cuicocha Crater Lagoon during an easy to moderate grade 4-5 hour hike through the flora of the Andean highlands. We also visit Cotacachi, known for its handmade leather articles. Overnight Runa Tupari similar (BLD) Note – Alternatively it is possible for clients to take a boat tour of the lagoon instead of doing the hike. This is subject to availability and cannot be booked in advance.

Otavalo – Peguche Cascades – Papallacta (approx. 3hrs driving) Today visit Otovalo market and meet skilful native merchants that create colourful pieces using the same techniques as their ancestors, such as alpaca sweaters, ponchos, hammocks and pan flutes. We then visit a house of a respected maestro in rondador, a small panpipe producing a distinctive sweet sound. After the visit we continue to Peguche waterfall, an important place for the local people, where we take a short walk and be educated about the importance of this sacred place. We then make our way to Papallacta, a first-class hot springs resort, located in the Amazon region. Overnight Termas Papallacta or similar (BD)

Amazon Adventure (approx. 5hrs driving) This morning, we head to the upper Amazon along a scenic stretch of road that takes us out of the Andes highlands and into the Amazon. We stop at Wayra Reserve, where you can find a large variety of flora and fauna, and home to some amazing birdlife such as the Rufous-Breasted Wood Quail. After the visit we head to our lodge where we will spend the next 3 nights. Overnight Suchipakari Lodge or similar (BLD)

Amazon Experience Today explore the jungle with your native guide, observing the variety of flora and fauna. We also visit the famous animal refuge known as AmaZoonico, founded to protect the native and wild animals of the area that have been injured, mistreated or confiscated due to smuggling. After lunch we visit a native Quichua family where we will learn how ‘chicha’, their local alcoholic drink, is prepared. You can also experience using the blowgun – an important weapon used by the people of the jungle when hunting food. After the family visit, explore the caiman lagoon where you can view the reptiles that live here. Overnight at the lodge (BLD)

Amazon Experience This morning take a hike through the protected rainforest of the lodge. Your nature guide will point out interesting medicinal plants and talk about the wildlife in the area. After the walk and lunch, we discover why Ecuador is the best place to enjoy chocolate. Learn how to make delicious chocolate from the local cocoa beans. After returning to the lodge, enjoy the rest of the afternoon at leisure. Overnight at the same lodge (BLD)

Macas (approx. 4hrs driving) After breakfast, travel through the rainforest to Puno where we visit an Animal Rescue Centre to observe tropical animals of the Amazon region and meet some monkeys face to face. From here, continue deeper into the rainforest to the small jungle town of Macas. Here there will be some time to relax at leisure in the afternoon. Overnight Hosteria Piedra Amazónica or similar (B)

Macas - Shuar Waterfall – Lagoons of Atillo – Guamote (approx. 3hrs driving) A short drive, takes us to Shuar territory. Take a round trip of walk of around 3 hours through the forest to a sacred waterfall, where we participate in the spiritual waterfall ceremony of the Shuar, after which enjoy a soak in the waterfall and taste the typical food of the Shuar. Later, continue to the Atillo Lakes, crossing the Andean highlands to Guamote. Overnight Inti Sisa Hotel or similar. (BD)

Guamote – Riobamba (approx. 1hr driving) Our day begins with a visit to the Church of La Balbanera on the outskirts of Riobamba, first built by the Spaniards, making it the first catholica church in the region. Continue to Colta Lagoon and explore the area before driving to the community of La Moya, formed of 68 families. Experience the man’s relationship with the sacred mountain Chimborazo with their legends and traditions rooted in the community, and visit the mountain museum ‘Urkukunapak Wasi’ where the myths and legends are on display. Our final destination is Riobamba, Ecuador’s first capital city. Spend the evening at leisure. Overnight Mansion Santa Isabella or similar (BL)

Chimborazo Wildlife Reserve - Tigua (approx. 5hrs driving) Today we visit the Chimborazo Wildlife Reserve, located on the slopes of the highest mountain in Ecuador. We begin at the reserve’s interpretation centre (starting at 4630m) where you will hear about the flora and fauna of the reserve, before heading to the mountaineer’s refuge. After we continue to Tigua, a small village close to Quilotoa. Overnight Posada de Tigua or similar (BD)

Quilotoa Lagoon (approx. 3hrs driving) This morning visit the Andean market of Zumbahua and experience the noisy and chaotic market before heading to the beautiful crater lagoon, Quilotoa. On a short hike, enjoy the changing views of the lagoon and the surrounding Andes Mountains. Overnight Mama Hilda Hotel or similar (BLD)

Cotopaxi National Park (approx. 4hrs driving) This morning we travel south to the central Ecuadorian Andes and Cotopaxi National Park. and enjoy an easy walk around Limpiopungo Lagoon, learning about the typical vegetation of the Andes and, with good weather, enjoy superb views of the impressive Cotopaxi. Lunch is taken in the mountain refuge Tambopaxi surrounded by the impressive peaks of Sincholagua and Cotopaxi. Overnight El Porvenir or similar (BLD)
Departure from Quito (approx. 2hrs drving) Time at leisure until your transfer to the airport for your onward flight. (B) Please book a flight after 1500 hours.

placesVisited: Quito, Cotopaxi Volcano National Park, Lake Limpiopungo, Banos, The Amazon, Arajuno River, Upper Napo River, Quijos River, Papallacta Hot Springs, Activities include: mountain biking, white water rafting, jungle walks
generalInfo:
Mainland Ecuador packs a lot of spectacular natural beauty into a tiny area. From Cotopaxi and cloud forest to capybaras and even jaguars, scenery and wildlife compete for your attention at every turn. Take nine days and you can really get stuck in. The best way to enjoy this country is to be adventurous – and you can have the perfect adventure on this tailor-made tour.

From Quito, Ecuador’s capital, you’ll be whisked straight to the slopes of Cotopaxi, the active Andean volcano, for mountain biking. After a rewarding soak in the hot springs at Banos, cycle down into the Amazon Basin where you’ll stay in a lodge surrounded by tropical rainforest. A boat trip gets you to the Arajuno River and an animal rescue centre where you can see toucans, parrots and monkeys, so you know exactly what to look out for in the wild.

See lovely traditional ways of life preserved in the communities who live along the river banks – and then reach the exciting churning waters of the Upper Napo River. Prepare for a wild ride; here you can tackle big waves on a thrilling white water rafting adventure. Treat this exciting day out as preparation you for further white-knuckle rafting on the famous Quijos River. Reward yourself afterwards with a soak in the ‘Valley of the Waterfalls’ – a relaxing end to your trip.

dayInfo.description: On arrival you will be met by our local guide, who will help you acclimatise to Ecuador and make sure the trip runs smoothly. We will take you to your hotel and, depending on your time of arrival, you can spend a few hours exploring Quito and its amazing old town before bedding down for the night.

Today will be your first taste of adventure and in true Ecuadorian style it begins on the slopes of the giant Cotopaxi Volcano. Descend by mountain bike from the roadhead at 4800m through fields of volcanoes, lava and Inca ruins to a height of 3700m. After a refreshing lunch you will ride from Lake Limpiopungo along dirt roads and single tracks through the pine forest that covers the slopes of Cotopaxi. Once down, we will drive you on to the town of Baños. (B/L)

To work up an appetite for breakfast, we suggest a dip in the local thermal baths, for which Baños is famous. The day then begins with a bike ride to the Amazonian frontier town of Puyo, taking you down from the Andes into the warm and humid Amazon basin. You can choose to do 20km of this route or the full 55km, but either way it is all down hill! After you have reached Puyo and had some lunch you will carry on by car, driving through Quichua villages and tropical rainforest to a beautiful lodge overlooking the majestic Napo River. (B/L/D)

Today is an opportunity to experience life under the vast green canopy. After a filling breakfast, you will join other guests from the lodge and cruise by motorised canoe down a myriad of channels until you reach the Arajuno River. Here you'll be able to visit the animal rescue centre AmaZOOnico and see a great variety of jungle animals including toucans, parrots, monkeys, jaguars and capybaras. After lunch, cool off with a refreshing swim in the river before visiting one of the many indigenous communities that live along the Napo river. These villages have developed their own brand of tourism which offers you an insight to their daily lives by demonstrating modern and traditional activities like gold panning, pottery making, making the traditional drink 'chicha' from yuca and blowpipe hunting. Afterwards, head back to the lodge for a rest before dinner. (B/L/D)

Today it's time to get on with the adventure and drive up into the hills for a rafting trip on the Upper Napo river, also known as Jatunyacu, which means 'big water'. And BIG is probably the best word to describe this river - big waves and lots of fun! Jatunyacu is crystal clear as it flows from the Llanganates National Park, an extremely rugged and uninhabited mountain range believed by some to be the hiding place of Inca gold. (B/L/D)

After a hearty breakfast, take a refreshing swim in the nearby waterfall Cascada de Latas. After you have dried off, a short 10-minute canoe ride takes you to a hiking trail through the forest, with the chance to see the luxuriant plants and shy animals of the Sumaco Biosphere reserve. After a delicious lunch back at the lodge you will then be driven to the Quijos valley where hot showers and a home-style meal await you. (B/L/D)

Refreshed by a good night’s sleep, today you will experience the thrill of the Quijos river , fast becoming one of the best-known rivers for white water rafting in Latin America. Pull on your wetsuit for a day of rafting through exciting rapids and past some of Ecuador’s most beautiful scenery. After successfully running the rapids, you'll be taken up the 'Valley of the Waterfalls' to the Termas de Papallacta Spa for a well-earned soak in the volcanically-heated mineral waters. The best thing is that you will spend the night here, so there's plenty of time to enjoy a massage or two. (B/L/D)

How best to relax is the biggest question of the day. Sleep in late? Soak in the thermal baths and get pampered in the spa? Stroll along the river bank path? Finally, after a delicious lunch, it's time to head back to Quito and a last night get-together. (B/L)
Today you have a choice to make…Fly home or explore the Galapagos Islands. Tough decision!

generalInfo:
A 2 week small group adventure holiday in Ecuador. Create your own action packed itinerary with optional outdoor activities, such as mountain biking and horseback riding, guided walks and canoe rides in the Amazon Rainforest.

Historic Quito, the Andes and the Amazon are all included in this comprehensive itinerary so you can enjoy browsing in the markets, exploring the rainforest and walking the mountain passes.

This is a small group adventure with a max group size of 16, average 10.

dayInfo.description: Quito. Arrive any time
Quito/Baños. Travel to Baños where you can choose from a variety of optional outdoor activities like hiking, ziplining, and canyoning. Or, take it easy and relax in local hot springs.
Baños. A free day to continue to enjoy the activities in this adventurous town.
Baños/Tena. Travel by bus into the Amazon Jungle. Spend two nights in rustic jungle huts in a local Quichua community. Enjoy nature walks and learn about local culture.
Tena. Learn about local life in the Amazon RainforestAmazon learning about local life in the jungle & spend the night in jungle huts in a Quichua community.

Tena/Papallacta. Travel by bike to the nearby community of Shandia and discover the beauty of the Amazon with a member of the community as your guide. Later, take a local bus to Papallacta and relax in the natural mineral hot pools with volcanic views.
Enjoy a relaxing morning at the hot springs before travelling back to Quito for free time to explore.

Quito/Otavalo. Explore the largest handicraft market in South America, Otavalo market. Villagers from the surrounding countryside come every week to sell handmade goods as well as livestock, fruits, and vegetables.
Otavalo/Cotopaxi. Travel to Cotopaxi National Park and explore the area or mountain bike trails with views of thei Volcano. After a busy day relax in a mountain lodge near the national park.
Day 10: Cotopaxi/Alausí. In the morning, visit Cotopaxi National Park before continuing on to Alausi.
Alausí/Cuenca. All aboard the train for an included excursion bound for the Devil's Nose. Afterwards, we head to Cuenca with its impressive colonial architecture.
Cuenca. Enjoy a free day to explore beautiful Cuenca. Opt for a city tour, go hiking in Cajas National Park, or soak in nearby hot springs.
Cuenca/Quito. A final flight back to historic Quito for our last night
Quito. Depart at any time.

generalInfo:
Get ready for an unforgettable journey to Ecuador, a vibrant country named after the equatorial line that runs right through it. Here, ancient history and unparalleled biodiversity converge in an astonishing territory, showcasing some of the most incredible natural wonders.

From the majestic peaks of the Andes, which traverse the country from north to south, to the golden beaches of the Pacific, every corner of Ecuador tells a story. You'll marvel at its imposing volcanoes, lush valleys, and snow-capped peaks, where life flourishes in a unique display of biodiversity.

-A Journey into the Heart of Ecuadorian Culture-
Within these breathtaking landscapes, not only have species that are a living testament to evolution thrived, but also unique communities. Immerse yourself in their colorful festivals, traditional folk dances, and exclusive crafts that reflect the history and spirit of a people proud of their roots.

-The Galápagos Islands: A Wildlife Sanctuary-
Your sublime adventure will take you to the Galápagos Islands, the second-largest marine reserve in the world and a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1978. This wildlife sanctuary harbors endemic species guarded by its iconic habitants: the giant tortoises, the curious blue-footed boobies, and the playful sea lions.
Explore their astonishing golden and black beaches, where crystal-clear waters reveal a vibrant underwater world.

-Unforgettable Experiences Await You-

On this trip, you'll uncover the wonders of Ecuador's most outstanding places. You'll have the opportunity to explore and learn directly from the very veins of Ecuadorian culture: its origins, beliefs, and traditions. Not only you will understand the importance of keeping their customs alive, but you'll also enjoy the ecological spaces that bring them to life in their maximum splendor.

-This unforgettable tour will allow you to-:

---Discover the history of La Mitad del Mundo (The Middle of the World).
---Explore the largest and most important craft markets.
---Delight in Ecuadorian gastronomy, from exquisite seafood to traditional sweets.

Additionally, you'll have the chance to experience unique adventures like the chocolate route or the butterfly garden, or even challenge yourself with extreme activities, hikes, or guided tours.

Undoubtedly, Ecuador is a destination where you'll feel like the country itself: full of life and interest! Are you ready for this adventure?

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Ecuador ! One of the smallest countries in South America, yet one of the most diverse, Ecuador awaits you with open arms. Upon your arrival at the airport, your guide and driver will be there to warmly welcome you to Quito, a megadiverse nation filled with unforgettable experiences. After checking in at your hotel, you will have the afternoon and evening free to explore at your own pace and be enchanted by the magic of this fascinating destination. Your adventure in Ecuador is about to begin!

OTAVALO: Embark on an unforgettable adventure with our Full Day Otavalo, a journey filled with culture, history, and breathtaking landscapes. - The day begins early with departure from Quito, heading to Quitsato, the impressive solar clock located at the Middle of the World, where you’ll uncover the mysteries of the equatorial line. Next, we stop in Cayambe to indulge in the famous freshly baked biscuits, paired with traditional cheese or caramel spread. The magic continues in Peguche, where a short hike leads us to its majestic waterfall, a sacred site for the indigenous Otavalo community. The heart of the journey takes us to the Plaza de los Ponchos, the largest artisan market in South America, bursting with colorful textiles, unique handicrafts, and the essence of Otavalo culture.

CUICOCHA & COTACACHI Excursion: - After a delicious breakfast, you'll embark on a journey to the majestic Cuicocha Lagoon, an impressive volcanic crater three kilometers wide, located an hour northwest of Otavalo. Nestled at the foot of Cotacachi Volcano, this spectacular landscape will captivate you with its two small islands and an imposing cliff surrounding the lake. We hope you are ready, because during your visit, you will be able to enjoy various adventure activities, such as hiking around the crater or taking a boat ride to explore the islands up close. Keep your eyes peeled and your mind open for the fascinating bird species that inhabit the region and marvel at the lush flora, including orchids, Andean shrubs, pines, and much more. Next, you'll head to the charming town of Cotacachi, renowned for its leather craftsmanship. Here, you'll find numerous artisans skillfully creating beautiful leather products. The streets of Cotacachi are filled with art, and you'll have the opportunity to explore the shops and purchase any items that catch your eye. Finally, you'll be transferred back to your hotel for a well-deserved rest.

Today, you'll enjoy a private transfer to the Mitad del Mundo tour, located near Quito, where you'll be fascinated by the unique experience of being in both hemispheres at the same time, and you'll explore its interactive museum. There, you'll have countless options to enjoy the Mitad del Mundo City, like testing excellent restaurants, immersing yourself in the culture while visiting handicraft shops, and even the planetarium. Optionally, you can visit the Pululahua volcano crater for a connection with nature. This tour, lasting half a day or a full day, is ideal for discovering Ecuador's cultural and geographical wealth. Afterwards, you'll be transported to the heart of Quito, whose historic center is one of the best-preserved in Latin America. Marvel at the grandeur of its churches, museums, and the symbolic Virgin of El Panecillo, silent witnesses to centuries of art and history.

Tour COTOPAXI VOLCANO: After breakfast, your private transportation and guide will be ready to take you on a thrilling adventure to Cotopaxi National Park. The journey will lead you through the majestic Avenue of the Volcanoes, where you can delight in the impressive views of the Andean peaks and their high-altitude grasslands. Upon arrival at Cotopaxi National Park, weather permitting, you will have the opportunity to gaze upon the majestic Cotopaxi volcano, the most active in Ecuador, which rises imposingly to a height of 5,897 meters. During the tour, you will visit Limpiopungo Lagoon, whose name means "Clean Door or Place."

BAÑOS DE AGUA SANTA: Today, we will explore the city of Baños de Agua Santa, located in the province of Tungurahua. Its name refers to the thermal springs that emerge in the area. Baños offers a pleasant tropical climate and a relaxed and peaceful atmosphere, perfect for enjoying nature. After breakfast, we will venture onto the Waterfall Route. We will visit the famous Pailón del Diablo (Devil's Cauldron), an impressive waterfall over 80 meters high. Its name comes from the cauldron-like shape carved by the force of the water over time. To access this natural spectacle, we will cross hanging bridges that will allow us to appreciate the waterfall up close and immerse ourselves in its surroundings. We will enjoy balconies halfway up the waterfall that offer stunning views, ideal for taking pictures. Later, we will visit the fascinating Manto de la Novia (Bride’s Veil), another beautiful waterfall. We will also have time to explore the central park of Baños, its traditional Gothic Church, and enjoy the delicious melcochas, a typical sweet of the region.

Baños is known as the world capital of extreme sports. On this day, you'll have private transport at your disposal to explore all the adventure options the city offers. One of the most exciting activities you can enjoy is canopy, a unique experience where you'll glide along cables at great heights, surrounded by stunning landscapes and nature. But that's not all; you'll also have the option to test your nerves with other extreme activities like bungee jumping, rafting on the Pastaza River, or puenting, for the most daring. The guide will take you to the Baños market, a vibrant place where you can relax after a complete day of adrenaline and explore and taste a new and fantastic adventure: the many varieties of fresh fruits and vegetables grown in the region. Here, you'll experience the local culture and take home fresh, local souvenirs. Finally, you'll end the day visiting a melcochas factory, a traditional candy made from sugarcane, known for its smooth texture and unique flavor. You'll see how this candy is made artisanally and, of course, enjoy a delicious sample! This day will be the perfect blend of adrenaline, culture, and flavor—a memory that will stay with you forever!

On this full day to the Faunistic Reserve "EL CHIMBORAZO", we will start the day with an early departure from your accommodation towards the reserve, located at the foot of the impressive Chimborazo volcano. Upon arrival, a specialized guide will give you an introduction to the fauna, flora, and the importance of Chimborazo, the closest point to the sun on Earth. We will enjoy a walk along the park trails, where you can observe species like flamingos, deer, vicuñas, and llamas, while also learning about the native plants and conservation efforts. Afterward, we will make a stop at the mountain refuge to enjoy panoramic views of the volcano and have a picnic-style lunch. In the afternoon, we will visit the Whymper Refuge, a historical place that honors the British mountaineer Edward Whymper, the first to summit Chimborazo. Here, in addition to learning about its history, you will enjoy impressive views of the volcano and its surroundings.

CAÑAR - CUENCA: Start your day by visiting Balbanera, the first Catholic church in Ecuador, and then head to the tagua workshop, where you can appreciate the art of vegetable ivory. During the journey, enjoy views of quinoa fields and ancestral homes of the Chocoto community. Don’t forget that every Thursday the Guamote market takes place, ideal for exploring local products and the animal market. After a delicious lunch in Cañar, with views from the "Mirador del Diablo," you will continue to Ingapirca, the most important archaeological site in the country, before spending the night in Cuenca and enjoying its colonial charm.

CUENCA: Explore Cuenca’s historic center, visiting the New Cathedral, Calderón Square, and the French Route. Discover the Broken Bridge before enjoying lunch. In the afternoon, tour the Homero Ortega Panama Hat Museum and admire orchids at Ecuagenera. - Visit Chordeleg, renowned for its silver jewelry, and stroll through artisan workshops. Continue to Gualaceo, exploring its vibrant market and witnessing the traditional ikat textile-making process. After lunch, relax by the Santa Bárbara River and visit an orchid plantation. Conclude the day with panoramic views from Turi Viewpoint before returning to Cuenca. - Travel to Cajas National Park to explore its lakes and unique páramo landscapes, including Laguna La Toreadora. Enjoy a picnic before heading to Hacienda Cacao y Mango for an immersive cocoa experience, learning about chocolate production. - This journey will be filled with incredible flavors, culture, colors, and a living tradition through the crafts and markets you'll visit. You'll also have wonderful experiences helping families and communities with your visit and active participation. The meals included in this trip will energize you for each new trip.

GUAYAQUIL: Start your day with an early departure from your hotel and head to Parque Seminario (Iguanas Park), where iguanas roam freely, offering perfect photo opportunities. Then, visit Malecón 2000, a stunning waterfront promenade where you can explore gardens, fountains, cafes, and sculptures along the Guayas River. Continue to the historic Las Peñas neighborhood, where you can enjoy the colorful streets filled with murals and galleries, and then head up to Santa Ana Hill for panoramic views of the city. - For a change of perspective, take a ride on the Aerovía, a modern aerial transport system that offers a bird's-eye view of the city. Afterward, enjoy a delicious lunch at one of the local restaurants, where you can savor traditional Ecuadorian seafood.

SANTA CRUZ ISLAND: Start the day with a delicious breakfast at the hotel. Your guide and driver will be waiting for you at the hotel and will take you to the Guayaquil Airport, ensuring that you arrive for your international flight. - Your guide will assist you with the boarding process at Guayaquil Airport, making it simpler and more comfortable with some instructions you will receive. - Exploring the Wonders of Santa Cruz – Lava, Tortoises, and Conservation! The adventure begins! Upon arrival in Baltra, our guide will be waiting to welcome the explorers and accompany them on an unforgettable journey. Aboard a public bus, we will head to the Itabaca Channel dock, where a ferry will take us to the majestic Santa Cruz Island, the gateway to a world of natural wonders. - The first encounter with the magic of Galápagos happens beneath the earth: we will explore lava tunnels formed by ancient volcanic eruptions, natural underground passageways that reveal the secrets of the islands' origins. Then, we will visit a giant tortoise reserve, where these magnificent creatures will teach us about patience, resilience, and life in its purest form. - And this is just the beginning of the great Galápagos adventure!

TORTUGA BAY BEACH - Our excursion will begin at 8:00 a.m., with a 40-minute walk along a beautiful natural trail that will take us to the famous Tortuga Bay Beach. This beach is known for its white sand and lush green mangroves. In the area known as "Playa Mansa", you will have free time to swim and enjoy a peaceful morning in this tropical paradise. Afterward, you'll have free time for lunch on your own. (The best dining spots will be recommended to you). We will also visit some magnificent places susch as Punta Estrada, "La Lobería", a place famous for its large population of sea lions, "Canal del Amor", a spectacular natural landscape and "Playa de los Perros", a spot where you can see marine iguanas in their natural habitat!

We will depart early in the morning from your hotel to the Itabaca Channel dock or Puerto Ayora, where we will board a yacht to begin our exciting tour of the Galápagos Islands, with lunch included on board. After the excursion, we will return to the hotel. - Remarks: Yacht tour operations in Galápagos are subject to availability and possible changes in itineraries, departure dates, etc., due to weather, operational, and logistical conditions. We guarantee yacht tours and visits but cannot ensure a specific destination.

SAN CRISTOBAL ISLAND: After breakfast at the hotel, we will transfer you to the dock in Santa Cruz to board the public speedboat to San Cristóbal. Upon arrival, you will be welcomed at the dock and provided with a comfortable and safe transfer to your hotel. Accommodation included. - San Cristóbal, in the Galápagos Islands, is an amazing place to enjoy your free time. - Upon arrival at León Dormido, you will have the opportunity to enjoy two guided dives or snorkeling sessions, led by our expert guide. Discover the fascinating underwater world, where tropical fish, sea turtles, sea lions, hammerhead sharks, and much more await you. After exploring this iconic rock formation, we will head to a stunning beach, where you can enjoy a picnic-style lunch on board. Take time to snorkel, swim in the bay, or simply relax on the shore.

Farewell to the Galápagos Islands - Return to the Mainland. - Enjoy your final morning in the Galápagos Islands with a delicious breakfast at your hotel. At the scheduled time, we will meet at the hotel lobby and begin your transfer to San Cristóbal Airport (SCY) for your return to the mainland. - Upon arrival at the San Cristóbal Airport, you will go through check-in and security procedures for your flight to either Guayaquil to take your international connection flight . Remember that flights from the Galápagos to the mainland are typically around 2 hours long. - Before boarding, you will also go through Galápagos Biosecurity checks to ensure that no organic materials leave the islands. These checks are mandatory, so be sure to follow the guidelines and dispose of any prohibited items, such as fruits, plants, or soil, before your departure. - Once you board your flight, we wish you a smooth journey back to the mainland, and we hope to welcome you to Ecuador again soon for more incredible adventures!

generalInfo:
Ecuador offers an unforgettable family adventure, with captivating landscapes and vibrant culture. Begin in Quito, immersed in Indigenous heritage and spectacular architecture. Marvel at the equator line and enjoy Quito's charming cobblestone streets.

Transition to the Galapagos Islands for wildlife encounters. Witness giant tortoises, playful sea lions, and diverse marine life while island-hopping. Engage the family at the Darwin Research Centre and Chocogalapagos for interactive learning. Create cherished memories kayaking, hiking, and snorkelling these enchanting islands.

Continue to Otavalo, renowned for Indigenous culture and crafts. Immerse in bustling markets, honing bargaining skills and appreciating local artisans. Experience ancestral cuisine first-hand, preparing traditional Kichwa dishes with an Otavalo family.

Throughout this journey, Ecuador blends adventure, education, and cultural immersion for an enriching family trip. Kids will love exploring vibrant cities, encountering unusual wildlife, and bonding over new experiences. Parents will appreciate the blend of activity and cultural learning. Ecuador offers a memorable family vacation filled with diversity, discovery and quality time together.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL TO QUITO - Daytime flight to Quito, Ecuador's capital in the Andes. Upon arrival, transfer to Plaza Grande, a classically styled boutique hotel in Quito's historic city centre.

MIDDLE OF THE WORLD & CHOCOLATE EXPERIENCE - Visit the Mitad del Mundo (Middle of the World) monument just north of Quito which marks the equator's closest point to the city. Here you can stand in both hemispheres simultaneously. After lunch, learn about Ecuador's cocoa history on a chocolate tour ending in a delicious tasting experience. This diverse day encapsulates Ecuador's cultural, historical, and culinary wonders.

GALAPAGOS ISLANDS - The Galapagos adventure begins on Baltra Island, the archipelago's gateway. Home to the islands' main airport, Baltra boasts an eco-friendly design with advanced environmental techniques minimising emissions and energy use as the world's first ecological airport. Upon arrival, we'll be ushered into a VIP airport lounge to change, apply sunscreen, and enjoy a refreshing drink before transferring to the Itabaca Channel for the trip to an exclusive giant tortoise reserve in the Santa Cruz Highlands. Immerse in the breathtaking mountain and forest landscapes surrounding the camp, revelling in the serene hillside shared only with seasonal resident giant tortoises. This special encounter promises a tranquil introduction to the Galapagos' natural wonders, setting the tone for an unforgettable journey through this ecological paradise. Stay at Hotel Ikala Galapagos for 3 nights.

GALAPAGOS ISLANDS - Your day begins with kayaking or walking at idyllic Garrapatero Beach. Paddle the serene bay or walk to the brackish lagoon, a prime flamingo habitat. Next, we journey to the off-the-beaten-path Cerro Mesa viewpoint on Santa Cruz. From this panoramic viewpoint, we see the island's entire southern shore. Descending into a collapsed crater, you'll leisurely explore the unique terrain, searching for woodpecker finches, giant tortoises, and endemic flora - hallmarks of the Galapagos as a living evolutionary lab. After a delicious lunch, we visit "El Trapiche" to experience the traditional production of sugar cane. This sugar mill provides insight into the daily life of locals in this unique archipelago.

GALAPAGOS ISLANDS - Your day starts with a walk to pristine Tortuga Bay, home to marine iguanas and prime turtle nesting. Enjoy the beach through swimming, snorkeling or relaxing on the sand. After lunch, you'll visit the Charles Darwin Research Centre, the islands' hub for sensitive conservation projects focused on tortoises and iguanas. Then it's on to Chocogalapagos, a family-run business offering a hands-on chocolate-making experience. Under the guidance of owner Juan Daniel Navarro, you'll learn tempering techniques and craft chocolate tortoises filled with delicious homemade ganache.

GALAPAGOS ISLANDS - From Puerto Ayora, you'll take a public speedboat to San Cristobal Island. Upon arrival, check into Hotel Indigo before visiting the Interpretation Centre. Here you'll learn about the islands' natural history and human impact on the fragile ecosystem. Next, you'll head to Frigatebird Hill, home to magnificent and great frigatebirds. Observing these fascinating avian species in their natural habitat is a true highlight. You'll cap off the day at pristine Punta Carola beach, where a vibrant sea lion colony thrives along the 300-metre stretch of sand backed by dry forest. We'll keep an eye out for marine iguanas hidden among the bushes and rocks, showcasing the area's rich biodiversity. This immersive day promises memorable encounters with the diverse natural wonders and cultural fabric that make the Galápagos so captivating. You'll return with a deeper understanding of this ecological paradise.

GALAPAGOS ISLANDS - After adventurous days exploring the enchanting Galápagos, enjoy some well-deserved downtime. Unwind and relax at the hotel, soaking in the peaceful surroundings. For those still eager for adventure, enquire about additional options to further explore the islands' charms. Stroll local streets, savour a leisurely meal, or discover hidden gems nearby. With its unique blend of natural wonders and cultural experiences, the choices are plentiful. Revel in the tranquillity or seek more discovery in these captivating islands. The Galápagos offer both relaxation and adventure.

GALAPAGOS to HIGHLANDS - You'll bid farewell to the Galápagos and fly to Quito for Ecuador's dramatic Andean Highlands. Your adventure takes a cultural turn as we explore a region of scenic mountain ranges and fertile valleys.
