Your first stop is Taita Gundo, a family-run atelier preserving traditional Andean instruments. Led by esteemed musician Ali Lema, Taita Gundo showcases instruments like pingullos, dulzainas, quenas, and zampoñas - each holding cultural significance for the Quechua people of Imbabura province. Visitors are treated to a sample of their rich musical heritage. Immerse yourself in melodies as passionate artisans demonstrate their craft. Experience the soul of the Andes through iconic sounds and rhythms passed down through generations. After this introduction to indigenous culture, you'll transfer to Hacienda Cusin for two nights amidst the region's unparalleled beauty.

OTAVALO - Today you visit Otavalo, renowned as one of Ecuador's most captivating towns where thriving Kichwa culture adds to the charm. The heart of Otavalo is its famous craft market, a vibrant tapestry of colours showcasing unique objects and textiles. Lunch is a culinary adventure with Kichwa couple Claudia and Patricio at their Kawsaymi workshop. Set in a traditional tulpa fireplace kitchen, the hands-on workshop blends native flavours and ingredients for an unforgettable experience. Suitable for all skill levels, you'll learn ancestral cooking techniques and sample diverse culinary creations. From beginners to seasoned chefs, the workshop immerses us in Otavalo's indigenous food culture. We'll gain first-hand knowledge of traditional preparation methods and ingredients that have shaped the region's distinctive cuisine. An original gastronomic experience highlighting Ecuador's cultural riches.

ANDEAN CONDORS - Your morning starts at a rescue centre protecting Andean birds of prey where the star is the magnificent Andean condor, with an impressive wingspan over 8 feet. This invaluable facility provides insight into the Northern Andes' raptor diversity. Beyond the iconic condor, we'll discover an array of fascinating, beautiful birds. The centre not only showcases species but fosters appreciation and understanding of these remarkable birds. After this glimpse into the captivating world of Andean birds, you'll return to the Quito region. Your final night is at charming Hacienda la Jimenita, conveniently located near the airport and a fitting end to this cultural journey.

DEPART QUITO - On your final day, enjoy the natural beauty of Hacienda la Jimenita's private reserve. With 18 acres of well-maintained nature trails, it's an immersive experience for nature lovers. Take time to explore the trails, looking for the diverse bird species that call this area home, including 10 types of hummingbirds. Wander through lush landscapes, breathe fresh mountain air, and revel in the tranquil surroundings. After a day of exploration and relaxation, you'll be transferred to the airport for departure, bidding farewell to Ecuador with its wealth of natural and cultural wonders.

placesVisited: Quito, Mindo canopy tour, Amazon trek, Adventure activities, Condor park, Otavalo market, Cotopaxi National Park, Quilotoa lagoon, Cuenca, Cajas National Park, Santa Cruz, Santa Fe, Isabela, Charles Darwin Station, Flamingo Lagoon, Giant Tortoise Center, Los Tuneles
generalInfo:
A thousand kilometres off the coast of Ecuador, you'll find the awe-inspiring Galapagos Islands. Explore both the breathtaking mainland and the isolated archipelago with this budget, 23 day adventure and wildlife tour of Ecuador and the Galapagos.

We spend the first half of this holiday on mainland Ecuador, split between the country's two biggest natural highlights: the Andes and the Amazon. Arriving into the capital of Quito, where we will enjoy some city sightseeing, we’ll go to Mindo where we'll try zip lining above the cloud forest, looking out for hummingbirds, and visit a butterfly farm. We will then spend four days discovering the wildlife, scenery and people of the Amazon rainforest, navigating the Cuyabeno River by canoe to get to our forest lodge. After returning to Quito, we will visit a Condor park and browse the stalls of a huge indigenous market, before hiking to the spectacular Peguche waterfall.

We then head south, towards the Andean Moutains, stopping in Cotopaxi National Park, home to Cotopaxi Volcano, where we can do hiking, biking or horseback riding. There is also chance to go rafting in Baños and visit the beautiful Quilotoa Lagoon, before taking a scenic drive to the old colonial city of Cuenca through the Andes and visiting Cajas National Park.

Finally, we fly on to the Galapagos Islands, where we spend six days visiting three of the main islands; Santa Cruz, Santa Fe and Isabela; and an uninhabited islet. Highlights include seeing Giant Galapagos Tortoises on the Santa Cruz Highlands, snorkelling at Los Tuneles among a myriad of marine species and bird watching.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL At arrival at Quito airport, you will have a private transfer to your hotel in Quito. Accommodation at Hotel Ikala Quito or similar.

CITY TRIP QUITO – EQUATOR LINE – PULULAHUA CRATER (B, L): In the morning, you will be picked up at your hotel, to start your Quito city tour. At first, you will go to the Panecillo Hill, with the famous Virgin Mary statue. You will have an amazing view over the city. Then you will visit all the highlights: the la Basilica church, the main squares and the San Francisco church. After lunch, which is a typical Ecuadorian lunch, you will go to the ”Mitad del Mundo’ (Middle of the World)’ Museum called ‘Intiñan’. Here you can do experiments, to prove the effects the equator has on gravity. After this, you will also visit the Pululahua crater, before going back to Quito. Accommodation at Hotel Ikala Quito or similar.

MINDO – ZIP LINING – BUTTERFLY FARM (B, L): This private day tour takes you to Mindo, a small village on 1.400m where you can go zip lining, hiking and visit a butterfly farm. You can find hummingbirds and sometimes even a toucan! A local lunch will be given in the village. In the afternoon, you will go back to Quito. At around 11:00 PM a semi-private night bus will take you to the Cuyabeno Reserve in the Amazon, which will take about 8 hours. Overnight at bus.

ARRIVAL TO CUYABENO (L, D): The bus you took the night before will bring you to the Cuyabeno Bridge, which is the starting point of your Amazon adventure. From here, you will have a canoe trip down the Cuyabeno River to the lodge. The guide will share information about the Reserve, and important recommendations and other tips to begin the two hours navigation on the Cuyabeno River. Once you arrive to the lodge, you will be shown to your rooms and you can relax a little before enjoying a delicious dinner. Later, you will go on an exciting night walk through the rainforest. Accommodation in Dolphin Lodge or similar.

CANOE EXCURSION – AMAZON HIKE – ANIMAL SPOTTING (B, L, D): Early in the morning, you will go on a canoe excursion. During the brisk morning hours you have the best time to see the rainforest’s thriving activity. After breakfast, you will trek in the primary rainforest with the naturalist and native guides, who will explain us about the practical and medicinal uses of the plants. After lunch, you will go out with either paddling or motorised canoes to enjoy the beautiful landscapes and try to find species of monkeys and dolphins. After dinner, you will venture in the forest to find species of insects and, with a bit of luck, species of snakes or frogs. Accommodation in Dolphin Lodge or similar.

BIRDWATCHING (B, L, D): At the early activity you will have a good chance to watch some playful monkeys and some colourful birds. Then you will return to the lodge for breakfast. After breakfast you will go to the forest again. Then you will have lunch. In the afternoon, you will navigate along the Cuyabeno River where you will have a good chance of seeing the freshwater pink and grey river dolphins in a spectacular scenery. After that, you will go Birdwatching; here above the canopy you can see breathtaking views of the surrounding rainforest and you can observe a variety of species. After dinner, you will venture out on a night excursion to search for caimans (alligator family) and nocturnal birds. Accommodation in Dolphin Lodge or similar.

RETURN TO QUITO (B, L): After breakfast, you will navigate once again along the Cuyabeno river towards an Indian Community, where your naturalist guide will explain the culture and traditions of the native people, from the past to the present. Then, you will travel by canoe down the river back to the Cuyabeno Bridge from where you will take a semi-private bus to return to Quito. It will take approximately 8 hours to arrive. Accommodation at Hotel Ikala Quito or similar.

OTAVALO – CONDOR PARK – PEGUCHE WATERFALL (B, L): On this day, our guide will pick you up from hotel in Quito to go to a Condor park. Here you will learn about the birds and you can enjoy a bird show. After that, you will go to the Otavalo market, where you can walk through the market and enjoy the people and the local and typical Ecuadorian products that they sell. After the market, you will go to the Peguche waterfall. Here you can enjoy the forest while you are hiking to the waterfall. Accommodation at Hotel Ikala Quito or similar.

COTOPAXI HIKING / BIKING / HORSEBACK RIDING (B): After breakfast private transportation picks you up to go to the Cotopaxi National Park. You can choose to go horseback riding, mountain biking or just hiking. In the afternoon you will be dropped off at a local country house (Hacienda) where you can see alpaca’s and enjoy the mountains. Accommodation in Hacienda Papagayo or similar.

QUILOTOA LAGOON (B, L): In the morning you will be picked up by your guide to drive for about 1,5 hour to go to the Quilotoa crater lagoon. A beautiful lagoon in the middle of the mountains with an amazing hike down the crater. After a local lunch you will be brought to Baños, a little town in between the Andes and Amazon region where you will stay a couple of days. Accommodation in Hotel Posada J or similar.

BAÑOS BIKING (B): The atmosphere in Banos is laid back and relaxed in this sub-tropical climate. Tourists love to come to Baños for outdoor activities like rafting, canyoning, canopy, mountain biking or hiking. There is a beautiful route through the most impressive waterfalls of Ecuador, “Ruta de las Cascadas”. You will bike this route without a guide but with a good mountainbike, helmet and a map. You can take the optional canopy line “El Torpedo” ($ 20) or you can bungee jump off the bridge ($ 15). At night the town is full of entertainment like pubs, restaurants and bars, all in walking distance. Accommodation in Hotel Posada J or similar.

BANOS RAFTING (B, L): Today you go rafting at the Pastaza River with level III/IV rapids and in the afternoon you can visit the “Swing to the End of the World” (not included). In the afternoon you have time to relax. Accommodation in Hotel Posada J or similar.

ANDES ROUTE (B): After breakfast start drive down to Cuenca through the Andes with a private driver/ guide. Also possible to stop in Guamote, Aloasi (Nariz del Diablo train) or Ingapirca. There will be a lot of local indigenous people along the route, this together with the stunning Andes will give you enough picture material. Accommodation in Hotel Victoria or similar.

CUENCA CITY TOUR (B): After breakfast our guide picks you up for a private tour through the colonial city of Cuenca. Afternoon free to explore the city by yourself. Accommodation in Hotel Victoria or similar.

CAJAS NATIONAL PARK (B): Today you will visit the Cajas National Park and in the afternoon you drive to Guayaquil. From there you will fly to the Galapagos the day after. Accommodation in Hotel Wyndham Guayaquil or similar.

GUAYAQUIL – BALTRA – SANTA CRUZ HIGHLANDS (B, L): Early in the morning you fly from Guayaquil to the Island of Baltra (about 2 hours). At the airport in Baltra, you will meet up with the English speaking guide, who will take you to the port of Puerto Ayora (Santa Cruz Island) but before you get there you stop at one of the ranches in the highlands to visit to giant tortoises in their natural habitat. You will walk around and take some pictures of these amazing animals before getting to the village. Accommodation in Hotel Fiesta or similar.

SANTA FE (B, BL): After breakfast you will travel to Santa Fe Island. Geologically, it is one of the oldest islands in the archipelago. After a 45 minute boat ride, you will arrive to the bay of Santa Fe. There you will have a very nice snorkeling activity, if you are lucky, you can spot some birds on the rocks. After snorkeling, you will go to Playa Escondida or Garrapatero in Santa Cruz island and have a wet landing there, where you will have approximately 1 hour to discover the beach and after you go back on board and you will have your lunch. Accommodation at Hotel Fiesta or similar. * This tour is called ´Pesca Vivencial´ which means that you might be able to experience a fishing demonstration according to weather and park regulations. * Wet landing: It means that the boat gets close to the beach and from there you will disembark in the see, it is recommended that you bring extra clothing, as you might get wet.

CHARLES DARWIN RESEARCH STATION – ISABELA (B, L): After breakfast you will visit the Charles Darwin Station, where more than 100 scientists, educators and volunteers provide scientific knowledge and assistance to ensure the conservation of the environment and biodiversity of Galapagos. The guides will explain more about the famous giant tortoises. After a local lunch, you will take the public speedboat to Isabela (about 3 hours). After a brief rest at the hotel, you will head to the Flamingo Lagoon, which is the largest coastal lagoon found in the Galapagos and is one of the main reproductive sites for the grand majority of flamingos. Accommodation in Hotel San Vicente or similar

TINTORERAS AND WETLANDS (B, L): Early in the morning after breakfast you will have a tour to The Wetlands, here you will visit the Giant Tortoise Breeding Center, where you will spot small and giant tortoises in their natural habitat. The next activity is a visit to The Wall of Tears. * Please have in mind that the total length of the walk in The Wetlands area is approximately 3 to 4 hours. After lunch you will have a little break and then you will visit Tintoreras Islet. It is called like this due to a large crack, in which white-tip sharks known as Tintoreras come daily to rest at the bottom. You will have a transport which will take you to the pier of Puerto Villamil, here you will board a boat for 10 minutes to cross to the islet which is located across the bay. It will be necessary for passengers to use walking shoes or sneakers (closed shoes) to cross the volcanic rocks. You can also observe penguins, sea lions, marine iguanas and you can go snorkeling with colorful tropical fish while enjoying the beaches of Isabela. Accommodation in Hotel San Vicente or similar.

SNORKELING IN LOS TUNELES (B, S): Early in the morning, you will go on a boat ride from Puerto Villamil. You will explore the brilliant scenery in Los Tuneles which is considered the most beautiful place to snorkel in Isabela Island. You will get the chance to spot large quantities of seabirds such as the albatros, flamingos, blue footed boobies and the magnificent frigatebird. Besides, you can find species feedings such as tortoises, swimming iguanas, sea lions, manta rays, Galapagos penguins, lobsters, and sea snakes. Depending on when you will go to Los Tuneles, you can choose to explore Concha Perla by yourself before or after this, since it is very close to the dock. Accommodation in Hotel San Vicente or similar
FREE DAY ISABELA (B): On your last day of the Galapagos, you will have a free day in Isabela. You can relax or do an optional activity. Accommodation in Hotel San Vicente or similar

BALTRA – GUAYAQUIL (B): After breakfast, you will travel to Baltra Airport, from where you will depart to Guayaquil. Upon arrival you will be picked up by the hotel shuttle. In the hotel you can relax a little or explore Guayaquil by yourself. Accommodation in Hotel Wyndham Guayaquil or similar.
AIRPORT TRANSFER (B): Today you will have a transfer back to Guayaquil airport and your tour ends. End of services

tourName: Ecuador and Galapagos small group holiday
placesVisited: Quito, Cotopaxi National Park, Banos, Pailon Falls, Otavalo, Quitsato Equator Monument, Santa Cruz Island, Isabela Island, Guayaquil, Optional trip to Tintoreras Islands, Optional activities include: snorkelling
generalInfo:
This trip is a chance to see the Galapagos Islands and the culture and nature of mainland Ecuador. After the excitement of condors and volcanoes on mainland Ecuador there’s a chance to chill with iguanas, follow lumbering tortoises, and spot blue footed boobies in the unique Galapagos Islands. Unlike many Galapagos trips, which are on board boats, your tour will take place on land, mainly on Isla Isabela and Isla Santa Cruz, offering an unusual perspective of the islands. Your group will contain no more than 15 people, travelling by boat and bus, with a few optional hikes.

Start in Quito, Ecuador’s capital, with its UNESCO World Heritage centre, before heading into the lush high-altitude countryside of Cotopaxi National Park and on to Otavalo, a market town set among sacred mountains. In the large indigenous market at Otavalo, you’ll have a fantastic chance to engage with locals, and admire their beautiful handicrafts. Crossing the equator via the Quitsato Equator Monument, you’ll return to Quito and then head to the Galapagos Islands.

On the island of Santa Cruz in the Galapagos you may see giant tortoises. On Isabela you’ll have encounters with iguanas and volcanoes, and enjoy a spot of snorkelling. Depart for the smaller islands and you’ll see the famous birdlife: including beloved species like blue footed boobies and diminutive Galapagos penguins. At the end of the trip you’ll make a pilgrimage to the Charles Darwin Research Station – the research facility which started it all, where the wonders of the Galapagos Islands are preserved for future generations.

dayInfo.title: Join trip in Tumbaco, near Quito
dayInfo.description: : Our tour starts today in Tumbaco, a quiet rural neighbourhood of Quito located around 20 minutes from the airport and 45 minutes from the downtown city centre. Ecuador's mountain capital is the second highest in Latin America at 2,850 metres. It lies in a narrow valley at the foot of the Pichincha volcano. Arriving in the city by air is quite spectacular as you approach over snow-capped mountains and extinct volcanoes - we highly recommend booking a window seat! Due to the number of evening flights into Quito, our tour leader plans to hold a welcome meeting on the morning of day two and will leave a message in reception with details on timings and everything else that you'll need for the day. There are no activities planned today, so you're free to arrive in Quito at any time. If you'd like an airport transfer today, you'll need to arrive into Quito's Mariscal Sucre International Airport (UIO), approximately a 20-minute drive from our hotel. If you miss the meeting, our tour leader will inform you of any essential information as soon as you catch up. Our hotel in Tumbaco is a tranquil property. If your flight arrives earlier in the day, we recommend resting here and acclimatising to the altitude before the trip begins. It's approximately a 45-minute drive into downtown Quito, and the hotel can help to organise taxi transport for you if you'd like to head out and explore the city.

dayInfo.title: Travel to Otavalo via Parque Condor; visit Peguche village
dayInfo.description: : We'll go straight to rural Ecuador today, driving north towards the small market town of Otavalo. Set within a fertile valley encircled by imposing sacred mountains, Otavalo is idyllically situated and is well-known for its thriving indigenous communities. This area is a real introduction into the Andean landscapes and culture that make Ecuador so special. On the outskirts, just before we reach the town, we'll visit Parque Condor, a rescue centre for injured condors, with the opportunity to witness these marvellous birds up close. After arriving to Otavalo and eating lunch at a local restaurant, we'll continue this afternoon to the village of Peguche, which is famed for its local families who make and play panpipes - a quintessentially Andean tradition. We'll learn how the panpipes are made and listen to the experts play.

dayInfo.title: Walk at the Laguna Cuicocha; share in rural life at indigenous communities; visit Otavalo Market
dayInfo.description: : We'll drive out to the tranquil setting of Cuicocha this morning, a turquoise crater lake located at 3,100 metres, approached through a wonderful landscape of alpine vegetation. We'll walk on a segment of the trail that goes around the lake (an easy walk of approximately 90 minutes) - along the way, we'll try to spot the King of the Andes - the wide-winged condors that soar high above the valleys in graceful flight. Returning towards Otavalo, we stop at a neighbouring indigenous community, diving deep into their day-to-day activities, customs and way of life. This sharing of rural life is what makes Otavalo come alive, and we'll get a taste of this over a home-cooked lunch - seasonal food will be on the menu, which could be a traditional locro de papa (potato and cheese soup), fritada (fried chunks of pork served with all types of corn), yucca or quinoa served with meat and vegetables. The afternoon is at your leisure. You might like to spend some time discovering the local market. The Otavalenos are a dignified and assured people, proudly displaying their cultural traditions and ancient heritage through their handmade leather goods, wood carvings and weavings. After exploring the market, the visual majesty of the setting and the colourful dress of the local communities make Otavalo a great place to sip a hot chocolate and watch the world pass by.

dayInfo.title: Drive to the Mindo Cloud Forest Reserve; visit a chocolate factory
dayInfo.description: : We have a spectacular drive ahead of us today, leaving the sparse mountain landscapes of Otavalo for the dense cloud forest on the slopes of the western Andes. En route, we might make a small stop at a local biscuit factory, to try fresh bizcochos made in a wood oven. We'll also cross over the equator line and stop to commemorate this at the Quitsato Equator Monument. Continuing our journey, we drop several thousand feet on a beautiful drive to reach the village of Mindo. Much of this cloud forest area has been set aside as a nature reserve, playing home to over 400 species of bird, as well as some amazing flowers and plant life, beautiful waterfalls and pristine forest. In the afternoon we'll visit one of the region's chocolate producers. Ecuador is famous for its chocolate and here you'll learn about every stage of the process from bean to bar. And, of course, you'll get to taste some of the produce!

dayInfo.title: Explore the cloud forest on foot and by cable car; visit a hummingbird garden; drive to Quito
dayInfo.description: : An early start this morning gives us the best chance of spotting Mindo's bird life at a time when it is most active. One of our first stops is at a hummingbird garden, catching some of the iridescent colours of the many hummingbird species that feed here. We'll then go deeper into the mountains towards the Mindo-Nambillo reserve, and take a 'tarabita' (cable car) up the mountainside, getting a birds-eye view of the forest. The ride ends at a trailhead, and there are several walking possibilities here. One 20-30 minute walk takes us to a series of waterfalls, culminating in one of the area's largest drops - the Nambillo Waterfall. The longest trail takes about one hour from the trailhead to La Reina waterfall. The paths are well-maintained, predominantly downhill towards the falls but with a steeper uphill on the return. Our tour leader will decide based on the weather conditions and how you're all feeling - along the way we'll see if we can spot butterflies, orchids, bromeliads and, of course, birds. In the late afternoon we drive to Quito, entering the downtown area of the city for the first time today.

dayInfo.title: Walking tour of Quito's UNESCO Heritage Old Town
dayInfo.description: : Ecuador's capital is one of the best-preserved colonial cities of the Americas, and a UNESCO Heritage Site with a rich blend of colonial architecture, imposing churches and busy markets. We'll visit some of the main sites, including La Compania church with its elaborate gilded altars, walls and ceilings, as well as Quito's largest and oldest colonial church, the Church of San Francisco, built in 1553. A climb to the top of nearby Cerro Panecillo rewards us with a view across the city and the encircling Andes from the viewing platform at the statue of the Virgen de Quito. We'll have some time free this afternoon. You might like to visit one of the city's many museums or discover the Old Town at your own pace. Take the opportunity to try some tasty food in one of the city's many eateries. Ecuadorian food is incredibly tasty - we'll find plenty of spicy ceviches, plantain, yuca and soups or stews on the menu as we travel around.

dayInfo.title: Drive the Avenue of the Volcanoes to Cotopaxi National Park; walks at the Limpiopungo Lagoon
dayInfo.description: : Our journey today takes us through some of the most impressive mountain scenery in the entire country, into the landscapes aptly described by the German explorer Alexander von Humboldt as the 'Avenue of the Volcanoes'. Our destination is Cotopaxi National Park - just a two-hour drive from Quito, and home to Ecuador's second-highest volcano. Cotopaxi is a classic volcanic cone, snow-covered and rising an imposing 5,897 metres from the valley floor. Hopes of seeing the cone in its full glory are always high, but to manage expectations, it's important to mention that the peak is often covered by a puff of cloud! We won't let this detract from our visit - while we come for the splendour of the volcano, we'll stay for the magnificent, bleak scenery of the paramo (the high-altitude Andean grasslands). We'll take time to walk around the Limpiopungo Lagoon, an easy 90-minute hike, taking us around a shallow glacial lake that's a haven for waterfowl, hummingbirds and unexpected migratory species such as the Andean Gull and the Andean Lapwing, as well as wild horses. We'll return to our first hotel in Tumbaco this evening.

dayInfo.title: Fly to the Galapagos; view giant tortoises in the Santa Cruz highlands
dayInfo.description: : The Galapagos are an isolated chain of volcanic islands supporting a distinct and unique flora and fauna, including prehistoric creatures found nowhere else on earth. Of the extraordinary animals to be found in the Galapagos many are reptiles, such as the giant tortoise, land iguana and three species of non-poisonous snake. There are also several species of turtle, which come ashore to mate. Up to three quarters of a million seabirds flock to the islands, including a third of the world's blue-footed boobies, frigate birds, pelicans, cormorants, albatross and petrels. Of all the animals in this unique landscape, perhaps the most out-of-place is the penguin. Only 35 centimetres tall, the Galapagos Penguin can be seen swimming among tropical mangroves. Offshore it is common to see dolphins, sea lions and fur seals playing in the water. The Galapagos National Park charges a visitor fee, payable on arrival, which funds park maintenance and supervision in the Galapagos, as well as ecological study, conservation and infrastructure development in Ecuador's other national parks. Entry fees and the funds they generate for the national park system are among measures taken by the Ecuadorian government to protect its natural heritage. Today we fly to the island of Santa Cruz, the second largest island in the Galapagos. It also boasts the most varied of the islands' vegetation zones. We visit 'Los Gemelos', two volcanic depressions that give us a deeper understanding of the formation of the islands, as well as passing through the evergreen highlands, where we will have the chance to see the iconic giant tortoises. In the afternoon we're at leisure to discover the island's main town, Puerto Ayora.

dayInfo.title: Boat to Isabela Island, overnight in Puerto Villamil
dayInfo.description: : This morning, we leave Santa Cruz and journey west by speed boat for approximately two and a half hours. Our destination is nearby Isabela Island, where we'll spend the next two days. The largest of the Galapagos Islands, Isabela is formed from five volcanoes, of which two are still active. An idyllic paradise of white sand beaches and swaying palms, it's home to the second largest caldera on earth and the highest point in the archipelago. We'll base ourselves here, in the small town of Puerto Villamil on the southern coast. On arrival we'll visit the Arnaldo Tupiza breeding centre, where we'll discover the history of the famous Galapagos tortoise, including the centre's ambitious aim to restore their numbers and release them back onto the islands. We'll take the 1.5 kilometre/0.9 mile walk back to Puerto Villamil, via the Tunel del Estero (one of the island's lava tunnels), and two of the island's beaches, where we may see marine iguanas lounging about, sally lightfoot crabs on the rocky shoreline, or herons and lava gulls.

dayInfo.title: Walk up Sierra Negra Volcano; afternoon snorkel
dayInfo.description: : The beauty of staying on land during a trip to the Galapagos is having the opportunity to explore its volcanic side. The geological formation of the Galapagos lends itself to hiking, and the scenery is just as impressive as the wildlife. Today we start by taking a walk up the Sierra Negra Volcano, an immense 12-kilometre/7.5-mile-wide mass that dominates the southern half of the island. The walk up to the top is three hours, presenting us with some spectacular panoramic views of the Pacific, and across to the neighbouring islands. In the afternoon, we plan to snorkel at Concha y Perla and spot some of the many marine species that the Galapagos have to offer - sea lion, iguana, turtle, ray and a diverse array of reef species might be sighted, varying throughout the year depending on the tides, the weather and the season. Snorkelling equipment is available for rent locally.

dayInfo.title: Tintoreras Islands trip; return by boat to Santa Cruz
dayInfo.description: : Formed from volcanic lava flow, the tiny islets of the Tintoreras Islets are fantastic for viewing wildlife, and accessible by a short boat trip from Puerto Villamil. On land, there is an array of birdlife and an abundance of the famous marine iguanas that are endemic and unique to the Galapagos. In the water, turtles, Galapagos penguins and sea lions may be spotted swimming around. The wildlife's complete acceptance of our presence is a testament to the incredible diversity and unique quality of the Galapagos Islands. It makes it possible to view birds, reptiles and mammals from as close as a few feet. In the afternoon, we come back together for a boat journey back to Santa Cruz Island, where we'll spend the next three nights.

dayInfo.title: Visit Tortuga Bay; afternoon Charles Darwin Station visit
dayInfo.description: : This morning, we take a walk to Tortuga Bay (a 5-kilometre/3-mile return walk) where we'll have the opportunity to swim at one of the most spectacular beaches of the entire chain, an important turtle nesting ground. After lunch, we'll visit the nearby Charles Darwin Research Station which has been responsible for conservation projects within the islands since 1959 (the centenary of the publication of Origin of the Species). During our time here, we'll visit the centre to learn more about the area's unique collection of animal and plant life.

dayInfo.title: Discover Seymour, Plazas, Bartolome or Santa Fe Island
dayInfo.description: : Today, we'll discover one of the smaller islands of the Galapagos, and our plan is at the mercy of the yacht schedule departing from Santa Cruz. The island visited could be either Seymour, Bartolome, Santa Fe or Plazas Island - but no matter which island we will certainly have a display of wildlife. We may see sea lions playing in the water just off shore, land or marine iguanas strolling around, magnificent red-throated frigate birds, blue footed boobies, swallow-tail gulls or Galapagos penguins. After exploring on land, we will also do some snorkelling at one of the nearby sites. This boat trip may include people not travelling with Explore. Snorkelling equipment is included as part of the boat trip. Depending on the boat schedules, we might change the order of activities during your days in the Galapagos, and any change in daily schedule will be fully briefed to you in country by our tour leader. It's also possible that we will visit islands outside of the four above depending on the yacht providers.

dayInfo.title: Fly to Quito on the mainland
dayInfo.description: : Leaving the Galapagos behind today, we fly to Quito on the mainland (there may be a touchdown in Guayaquil en route). On arrival, we'll transfer to our hotel in the Tumbaco suburb of the city and enjoy a last evening together as a group.

dayInfo.title: Tour ends in Quito
dayInfo.description: : The trip ends after breakfast at our hotel in Tumbaco, Quito. There are no activities planned today, so you're free to depart from Quito at any time. If your flight is departing later in the day, luggage storage facilities are available at our hotel. If you'd like an airport transfer today, you need to depart from Quito's Mariscal Sucre International Airport (UIO), which is around a 20-minute drive from our hotel.

tourName: Ecuador and Galapagos tailor made holiday
placesVisited: Quito, Cloud forest, Cotopaxi National Park, Guamote, Devil’s Nose train ride, Cuenca, Cajas National Park, Guayaquil, Santa Cruz island, Isabela island, Los Tuneles, San Cristobal, Kicker Rock, Outdoor activities, Wildlife watching
generalInfo:
This tour takes you to all the best parts of Ecuador & the Galapagos Islands in 17 days. You will go to places where other tours will not take you. You will find out what the hidden treasures of this tour are when you arrive at the airport. Enjoy one of the most biodiverse countries in the world, you will visit the Galapagos Islands, the cloud forest, the andes mountains, some volcanoes, beautiful cities, the pacific coast and a local market. The highlights of this tour will be:

-Historical cities: you will visit Quito and Cuenca, beautiful historical cities.
-Cloud forest: here you can enjoy the amazing nature and different animal species.
-Volcanoes: take the perfect photos at three different volcanoes.
-Local villages: Guamote local market and the Tigua community will be visited.
-Pacific Coast: visit Guayaquil to enjoy the best weather and seafood dishes.
-Santa Cruz Highlands: your first contact with the Giant Galapagos Tortoises.
-Visit one of the uninhabited islands: Bartolomé, Santa Fe or Seymour.
-Los Tuneles: snorkel in the clear waters and swim with different animal species.
-Kayak in Tintoreras Bay: if you are lucky you will find some sharks here!
-San Cristobal Island: the island with the Sea Lion beach.
-Snorkel at Kicker Rock: one of the most spectacular places of the Galapagos.

dayInfo.description: AIRPORT PICKUP – TRANSFER TO HOTEL You will start your Hidden Treasures tour today. You will be picked up at the Mariscal Sucre International Airport (UIO) and brought to your hotel, which is located in the center of Quito. Depending on the time of arrival at the airport, you will have the chance to explore Quito by yourself and taste the local dishes and drinks. Of course it is also possible to rest, because you might be tired after the long flight. Accommodation in Hotel Ikala Quito or similar.

HISTORICAL CENTER – COOKING CLASS – CAPILLA DEL HOMBRE (B, L) After breakfast in the hotel you will go to the Historical Center of Quito to explore the many UNESCO World Heritage Sites. After getting an impression of this beautiful city, you will get a cooking class where you learn how to cook local dishes. In the afternoon you will visit the Capilla del Hombre where you will have an amazing sight over the city. (All transportation is included). Accommodation in Hotel Ikala Quito or similar.

INTIÑAN MUSEUM – PULULAHUA – CLOUD FOREST (B, L, D) In the morning we will visit the Intiñan museum and the Pululahua volcano. After that you will be transferred to a beautiful place in the Cloud Forest. Before lunch you will take a guided short walk to learn about some of Maquipucuna’s medicinal and useful plants. After lunch you will walk through the Bear trail and part of the Palmito or River trails in search of Spectacled bears or their traces. This is a moderate hike through Secondary and some Primary Forest. A local guide is mandatory during Spectacled Bear season. At 6pm the bar opens officially; however, if you desire a drink before then, please let the staff know and they will be happy to serve you. There is also the chance to do an optional guided night hike. Accommodation in Maquipucuna Reserve Lodge or similar.

BIRD WATCHING – HIKE TO WATERFALL / SELF GUIDED WALK (B, L, D) Wake up with a concert of birds and get ready for an early start. You have the first birding hike from 06:30 – 08:30 AM to enjoy the sounds and sights of dawn in the forest – which is when most birds are active and calling. Before lunch you will take the Humedal trail learning further about plants and watching birds as we progress into the the pre-Inca trail used by the Yumbos. As a reward, you will reach the Yumbo waterfall or swimming hole where you will have the opportunity to take a swim. After lunch you will visit the coffee orchard, the orchid garden and the organic garden. Alternatively after breakfast, you could take a half day or full day tour to the Ziplines, Tulipe archeological site or Mindo butterfly garden. You can also do an optional guided night hike. Accommodation in Maquipucuna Reserve Lodge or similar.

COTOPAXI – HORSEBACK RIDING (B, L) After breakfast you will drive to the Cotopaxi Volcano area, which takes about 4 hours to get there. You will start your tour with a very nice car ride from Quito through the Volcano Avenue; including the Pasochoa, Rumiñahui, Illinizas and others. When you arrive there you will have a lunch and after that you will do a horseback riding tour in the slopes of the Ruminahui Volcano. Accommodation in Hacienda El Porvenir or similar.

COTOPAXI NATIONAL PARK – LIMPIOPUNGO LAGOON – INSILIVI (B, L, D) When you finish your breakfast in the morning, and to continue your Hidden Treasures tour, you will visit the Cotopaxi National Park and the Limpiopungo Lagoon. After that you will depart to Isinliví and there you will have lunch. In the afternoon you will go for a trekking exploration around the Isinliví mountains. In the evening you will have a nice local dinner. Accommodation in the LluLlu Llama Mountain Lodge or similar.

QUILOTOA – TIGUA – GUAMOTE – CHIMBORAZO (B, D) In the morning you will visit the Quilotoa Loop and have the chance to hike down and actually feel the temperature of the lake, when time allows it you can even kayak on the lake. After that you will go to Tigua, where you will visit the local community. In the afternoon you will drive to Guamote, on your way there you have the chance to make some amazing photos of the Chimborazo volcano. Accommodation in Inti Sisa or similar.

GUAMOTE – DEVILS NOSE – INGAPIRCA – CUENCA (B) Today you will discover one of the many Hidden Treasures in the Andes: the Devil’s nose. Around 08:00 AM you will go on the Devil’s Nose train ride. You will learn about one of the greatest rail engineering feats worldwide while passing through the beautiful Andean scenery. In the afternoon you will visit the Ingapirca ruins after which you will be transferred to your hotel in Cuenca. Accommodation in Hotel Victoria or similar.

CUENCA – CITY TOUR – SPA CIRCUIT (B) Today, you will have a very relaxing day. This is your time to explore one of the most beautiful cities in Ecuador. Cuenca won South America’s Leading City Break Destination of 2018, and you will see in this tour why that is the case. It is an amazing city with a lot of UNESCO World Heritage Sites. You will start this day with a city tour around Cuenca, and after that, you will visit Piedra de Agua hot springs, a nice spot where you will get the chance to relax and unwind by doing a Spa Circuit. Accommodation in Hotel Victoria or similar.

CUENCA – CAJAS – GUAYAQUIL (B) After breakfast at the hotel, you will visit Cajas National Park. In this park you will spot many beautiful lakes. It is also home to many wild animals such as Andean condors, giant hummingbirds and coatis. After exploring the great wildlife and nature, you will continue to Guayaquil where you will enjoy the city by night and enjoy its beautiful panoramic views. Accommodation in Wyndham Guayaquil or similar.

TRANSFER GUAYAQUIL AIRPORT – BALTRA AIRPORT PICKUP – SANTA CRUZ HIGHLANDS (B, L) You will be brought to Guayaquil airport by the hotel shuttle. Upon arrival at Baltra Airport the guide will take you to Santa Cruz Highlands to make closer contact with the Giant Galapagos Tortoises as well as many kinds of birds, like the Wizard and Finch. The guides will explain more about the famous giant tortoises and you will have a local lunch here. Then you will be taken to your hotel where you have some time to relax. Accommodation in Hotel Fiesta or similar.

LONG DAY TOUR – UNINHABITED ISLAND (B, BL) Today you will go to one of Galapagos’ uninhabited islands. What island you will visit depends on what day of the week you will depart. Examples of islands you might visit are: Santa Fe, Plazas, Floreana, Bartolome or North Seymour island. You will spend the day snorkeling and discovering the island and its flora and fauna. In the afternoon you will return to your hotel. Accommodation in Hotel Fiesta or similar.

FREE MORNING – ISABELA ISLAND (B) After breakfast at the hotel, you have some time to discover the island by yourself. We highly recommend you to visit Tortuga Bay, where you will be able to spot a huge marine iguana colony. You can also go to the Charles Darwin Research Station. At 02:00 PM you will be brought to Isabela island by a public speedboat and you will arrive around 04:30 PM. After that you will be picked up and brought to your hotel. Accommodation in Hotel Volcano or similar.

LOS TUNELES (B,S) When you finish breakfast, you will go to Los Tuneles. This is one of the most spectacular places to go diving or snorkeling in Isabela Island, because the water is calm, very clear and shallow. After visiting Los Tuneles you will have time to visit some highlights by yourself; for example to Isabela Breeding Center, Wetlands or the Wall of Tears. Accommodation in Hotel Volcano or similar.

KAYAK IN TINTORERAS BAY – DROP OFF AIRPORT – SAN CRISTOBAL (B) Early in the morning you will have breakfast at the hotel. After that you have the chance to do a kayaking or stand up paddling tour in Tintoreras Bay. When you finish relaxing on the water, you will be picked up to be brought to the Isabela Airport. From there you will take a flight to San Cristobal. Here you can visit the Interpretation Center and Tijeretas on your own. A great thing is that San Cristobal airport is situated very well so it does not take to long to get to the places mentioned above. Accommodation in Casa Opuntia or similar

KICKER ROCK (B, BL) You will have breakfast at the hotel before going to Kicker Rock. This is one of the most spectacular landmarks of the Galapagos Islands. Two volcanic rocks of 140 meters tall, located off the coast of San Cristobal Island. This magnificent tiny island is the favorite place for an array of marine birds. But in the sea you see the great underwater life wherefore the site is that famous. The natural erosion of this ancient cone has created a channel between the rocks that provides the ideal habitat to view a variety of sharks and rays including eagle rays, white-tip reef sharks, and sometimes even the Galapagos sharks and hammerheads! Accommodation in Casa Opuntia or similar

GUAYAQUIL - TRANSFER OUT (B) This is the last day of your Ecuador Hidden Treasures tour. Depending on the time of your flight back to the mainland, you will be brought to Guayaquil airport. Any time of the day is fine to get your flight out, the transfer to the airport will be arranged for you.End of services

tourName: Ecuador and Galapagos tailor made holidays
generalInfo:
With a fine colonial heritage, Andean scenery and a trip to Ecuador has all the ingredients to give you a flavour of South America, but a week in the Galapagos Islands will bring you literally face to face with some of the planet’s most remarkable wildlife.

Highlights: Quito – Cotopaxi National Park – Galapagos Islands - Iguanas Galapagos

For further information about the range of Galapagos cruises and the choice of hotels and jungle lodges, please contact us. We can adapt this itinerary to include the Devil’s Nose, Ingapirca and Cuenca or extend the itinerary to include a relaxing stay at a hacienda, time to explore the cloudforest or simply to spend a few days at a hotel in the Galapagos after your cruise.

dayInfo.description: Departure from your destination – arrive in Quito Welcome to Ecuador! Arrival at Quito´s airport, reception, and transfer to the hotel in the Quito district, check in. Board Includes: Breakfast

Quito City Tour / Mitad del Mundo / Cable Car. Pick up from the hotel in Quito. The tour will then continue from the Basilica Church, where we will make a brief stop to visit it. After walking through the colonial streets, we will then stop at the Independence Plaza to admire the Cathedral and the Government’s Palace. We will also visit the Company Church, The Sagrario´s Church and San Francisco´s Church, which was built during the 17th century, you will also have the chance to taste Ecuadorian chocolate. After visiting the historical sights, we will go to the Teleferico. This is one of the best ways to enjoy our city with views of beautiful valleys, snow-capped mountains and the capital, Quito. From a point at more than 13,000 feet (4000 m), you will enjoy magnificent views of the city. After lunch, you will head to the Middle of the World monument, where you can stand right in the middle of the equatorial line and straddle the two hemispheres. In addition, you will have a chance to participate in several experiments at the Intiñan Museum. You will also enjoy the amazing landscape in Pululahua inhabited crater just 5 minutes from the Equatorial line. Accommodation in Quito. Accommodation: Hotel La Basílica Quito; Board: Breakfast.

Cotopaxi Volcano & Quilotoa Lagoon. The excursion starts at 7:00 from your hotel in Quito. Meet your guide and board a vehicle heading south of Quito and go along the Avenue of the Volcanoes and pass through the towns of Latacunga and Pujilí. Stop to visit an indigenous local house from the “Paramos” to learn about their traditions and way of life. Continue up to the Quilotoa volcano, where you will be able to descend to the lake located inside the crater or just walk around the crater. You will also be able to enjoy an unforgettable experience by kayak in the lagoon(optional). Lunch and drive back towards Cotopaxi National Park. Once you reach the National Park, you will visit the Interpretation Center and Limpiopungo lagoon. Take a short hike in the surrounding Limpiopungo valley. Overnight in Cotopaxi. Board Includes: Breakfast & Lunch.

Fly from Quito to the Galapagos Islands. We book a range of Galapagos cruises varying from luxury vessels made for up to 100 passengers to smaller yachts and catamarans with just 8 cabins and up to 16 passengers. Accommodation: On cruise of your choice. Board: full board.

Spend the next five days navigating between islands, each offering a unique landscape and ecosystem. You’ll enjoy two guided excursions per day — morning and afternoon — led by experienced naturalist guides certified by the Galápagos National Park. Activities Include: Guided hikes through volcanic terrain, highland forests, or pristine beaches Snorkeling in crystal-clear waters with sea turtles, rays, reef sharks, and colorful fish Kayaking or paddleboarding in tranquil bays Visits to tortoise breeding centers and research stations Birdwatching opportunities to spot iconic species such as the Galápagos penguin, flightless cormorant, and red-footed booby Cruise Experience: Choose between a larger luxury vessel with up to 100 guests offering more onboard amenities (like Jacuzzis, observation decks, and bars) or a more intimate experience on a yacht or catamaran with up to 16 passengers, ideal for personalized service and closer wildlife encounters. Accommodation: Aboard your selected cruise.
Your Galapagos Cruise concludes and you return to Quito. Overnight in a Quito hotel for your final night in Ecuador. Accommodation: Hotel La Basílica Quito; Board: Breakfast.
Transfer to the airport for your flight home. If you wish to extend the itinerary in anyway then let us know.

tourName: Ecuador Avenue of the Volcanoes holiday
generalInfo: Embark on a journey through central Ecuador, discovering the majestic Andes and the iconic Avenue of the Volcanoes. From the colonial charm of Quito to the breathtaking landscapes of Cotopaxi and Chimborazo, and the cultural richness of Cuenca, this tour combines stunning natural beauty with intense cultural immersion. This journey, which includes historic cities, majestic volcanoes, Andean flora, and artistic riches, offers an in-depth glimpse at the spirit of Ecuador.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at Quito Airport, your guide will meet you and transfer you to your accommodation. Surrounded by a chain of Andean mountains, Quito is the second-highest capital city in the world and offers one of the most breathtaking landscapes. Originally inhabited by the Quitu tribe in the first millennium, the city later became part of the Inca Empire before being destroyed and refounded by the Spanish conquistador Sebastián de Benalcázar in 1534. Its historic center, declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1978, is one of the largest and best-preserved in Latin America, featuring outstanding museums, churches, and art galleries. Accommodation at Illa Experience Hotel or a similar property.

The day begins at Chimbacalle Train Station, a symbol of Ecuador's railway revival. You’ll then explore Quito's Historic Center, the largest and best-preserved in the Americas, strolling along Calle de las Siete Cruces and Independence Square. Along the way, sample traditional Ecuadorian sweets and chocolate. The visit includes the Church of La Compañía, a tour of the Quito School, and the opportunity to create your own handicrafts. In the neighborhoods of La Ronda and San Marcos, enjoy art, music, and the warmth of the local community. Finally, experience a 17th-century mansion converted into a boutique hotel, spend time with a local painter, and close the day with a drink on the terrace overlooking El Panecillo. Overnight at Casa El Edén or a similar property.

After breakfast, we'll begin our tour, heading south from Quito along the famous "Avenue of the Volcanoes." Around noon, we'll arrive at Cotopaxi National Park, located 60 km from the capital. The majestic Cotopaxi, considered the highest active volcano in the world, is one of Ecuador's natural icons. In its surroundings, you can appreciate a variety of endemic flora and fauna, including the chuquiragua—known as the mountaineer's flower—as well as wild horses, deer, llamas, and other species. Within the park, you can also visit Limpiopungo Lagoon, at the foot of the Rumiñahui volcano (4,716 m), or take birdwatching hikes. At the end of the day, we'll continue to Baños, where we'll rest for the next stage of the adventure. Overnight at Hotel Floresta or similar.

Located in a valley filled with waterfalls and hot springs, Baños has become a popular destination for international travelers seeking a year-round mild climate, a friendly small-town atmosphere, and an ideal base for exploring Ecuador's natural beauty. Its name, which means "baths" in English, refers to its famous hot springs. The city offers a wide variety of activities, from waterfalls and outdoor adventures to horseback riding, not to mention the imposing Tungurahua Volcano, visible from any point in Baños. We'll take a short tour of the city center, enjoying its pleasant subtropical climate. Then, we'll begin the waterfall route, visiting iconic sites such as Agoyán, Puertas del Cielo, Manto de la Novia, Pailón del Diablo, Machay, and many more. Overnight at Hotel Floresta or similar.

After breakfast, our route will head to the province of Chimborazo, a perfect place for hiking and expeditions through diverse ecosystems, including Andean moors, lagoons, mountains, and forests. At 6,310 meters (20,697 feet) above sea level, Chimborazo is the highest peak in Ecuador. Its name is derived from Quechua: "rasu" translates as snow, while "chimbo" likely derives from "chimbana," which translates as crossing, alluding to the three snow-capped passes that surround the mountain. The region boasts abundant native flora and fauna, including the chuquiragua, also known as the mountaineer's flower, along with llamas and various birds. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to experience the unique ecosystem of the Andean moor. Overnight at Chimborazo Lodge or equivalent.

After breakfast, the tour continues south from Riobamba to Alausí, where we will board the famous "Devil's Nose" train. Along the way, we will make several stops to visit the Balbanera Church, Laguna de Colta, and the indigenous village of Guamote (the market is held on Thursdays). By mid-morning, we will arrive in Alausí and begin our adventure on the iconic "Devil's Nose" train. The tour lasts approximately four hours, returning to Alausí in the early afternoon. Our bus will be waiting for us to continue to Ingapirca; participants are welcome to bring a picnic lunch to enjoy during the journey. In Ingapirca, we will visit the fortress located 3,100 meters above sea level, considered the most important in the country. Its true history remains a mystery, as studies suggest it may have been a fortress, an observatory, or a temple. After touring the ruins, we will continue our journey to Cuenca, arriving in the early evening with optional dinner and free time to enjoy the city. Overnight at Hotel San Juan or similar.

After breakfast, the journey will head northwest toward Cajas National Park. After a short drive, we will arrive at the park, where you can enjoy various activities such as hiking, fishing, birdwatching, and discovering its diverse flora and fauna. We will also visit the Interpretation Center located at Laguna La Toreadora, the largest and most significant lagoon in the complex, where exhibits and information about the park are on display. Overnight at Hotel San Juan or equivalent.

After breakfast, we'll take a city tour of Cuenca. Despite being the third largest city in Ecuador, it maintains a welcoming provincial atmosphere. Its red-tiled buildings, cobblestone streets, flower-filled plazas, and museums distinguish it, and many consider it the most beautiful city in the country. On this full-day tour, we'll explore Cuenca's historic center, listed as a World Heritage Site, appreciating its beauty, brightly colored parks and plazas, religious monuments, and handicraft shops, while learning about the city's history. In the afternoon, we'll visit a workshop where the famous high-quality toquilla straw hats are made, and then climb Turi Hill for a panoramic view of the city. Overnight at Hotel San Juan or similar.

Finally, in Cuenca, your guide will accompany you to ensure a comfortable and hassle-free trip. They will accompany you on a private transfer to Mariscal Lamar Airport (CUE) for your domestic flight, which will connect you with your return international flight from Quito or José Joaquín de Olmedo International Airport (GYE) in Guayaquil.

tourName: Ecuador budget adventure tour, Amazon & Galapagos
placesVisited: Quito, Amazon trek, Canoe excursion, Kichwa Birdwatching Tower, Caiman spotting night excursion, Cotopaxi National Park, Mountain biking, San Cristobal, Kicker Rock, Paddle boarding at Playa Mann, Santa Fe, Isabela, Los Tuneles snorkelling, Quilotoa lagoon
generalInfo:
This 16 day tour takes in Ecuador’s most spectacular landscapes, with lots of wildlife spotting and adventurous activities included.

Our tour begins in the historic capital of Quito, dramatically located between massive mountain peaks. Here we’ll enjoy a cultural, sightseeing tour of the city highlights and a trip to Pululahua crater, before our Amazon adventure begins. We’ll spend the next three days exploring this incredible rainforest, getting up early to experience the morning shouts and calls of the birds and wildlife, paddling along the river that runs through the jungle in our canoe, and staying in an eco lodge. With any luck, we’ll spot monkeys, river dolphins, and maybe even snakes or frogs.

Our next stop is the Galapagos archipelago, where we will spend six days island hopping. Visiting San Cristobal, Santa Fe and Isabela, we’ll discover the fascinating and unique flora and fauna of the area. Highlights include swimming at Kicker Rock and snorkelling in Los Tuneles – a spectacular spot for seeing marine life. We will also try kayaking and paddle boarding, while keeping an eye out for sea lions.

We then return to mainland Ecuador, where we will visit the impressive Quilotoa Lake and a nearby indigenous market, as well as learning more about the local community. As part of the tour, we will also spend a day mountain biking in Cotopaxi National Park, where we will be greeted with views of the active Cotopaxi volcano, and you’ll have some free time to explore the town or beach on San Cristobal Island.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL: At arrival at Quito airport, you will have a transfer to your hotel. Accommodation at Hotel Ikala Quito.

CITY TRIP QUITO – EQUATOR LINE – PULULAHUA CRATER (B, L) Today your Ecuador complete tour will start! In the morning, you will be picked up at your hotel, to start your Quito city tour. At first, you will go to the Panecillo Hill, with the famous Virgin Mary statue. You will have an amazing view over the city. Then you will visit all the highlights: the la Basilica church, the main squares and the San Francisco church. After lunch, which is a typical Ecuadorian lunch, you will go to the Mitad del Mundo Museum, called ‘Intiñan’. Here you can do experiments, to prove the effects the equator has on gravity. After this, you will also visit the Pululahua crater, before going back to Quito. At 11:00 PM a semi-private night bus will take you to the Cuyabeno Reserve in the Amazon, which will take about 8 hours. Overnight at bus.

ARRIVAL TO CUYABENO (L, D): The bus you took the night before will bring you to the Cuyabeno Bridge, which is the starting point of your Amazon adventure. From here, you will have a canoe trip down the Cuyabeno River to the lodge. The guide will share information about the Reserve, and important recommendations and other tips to begin the two hours navigation on the Cuyabeno River. Once you arrive to the lodge, you will be shown to your rooms and you can relax a little before enjoying a delicious dinner. Accommodation in an eco-lodge in the Cuyabeno Reserve.

CANOE EXCURSION – AMAZON HIKE – ANIMAL SPOTTING (B, L, D): Early in the morning, you will go on a canoe excursion. During the brisk morning hours you have the best time to see the rainforest’s thriving activity. After breakfast, you will trek in the primary rainforest with the naturalist and native guides, who will explain us about the practical and medicinal uses of the plants. After lunch, you will go out with either paddling or motorized canoes to enjoy the beautiful landscapes and try to find species of monkeys and dolphins. After dinner, you will venture into the forest to find species of insects and, with a bit of luck, species of snakes or frogs. Accommodation in an eco-lodge in the Cuyabeno Reserve.

KICHWA BIRDWATCHING TOWER (B, L, D): An early activity will allow you to enjoy the nature with a good chance to watch some playful monkeys and some colorful birds. Then you will return to the lodge for breakfast. After breakfast you will go to the forest again. The native guide shares his wealth of knowledge, showing the medicinal and practical uses of the rainforest’s flora and fauna. Then you will have lunch. In the afternoon, you will navigate along the Cuyabeno River where you will have a good chance of seeing the freshwater pink and grey river dolphins. After that, you will visit the Kichwa Birdwatching Tower. After dinner, you will venture out on a night excursion to search for caimans (alligator family) and nocturnal birds. Accommodation in an eco-lodge in the Cuyabeno Reserve.

RETURN TO QUITO (B, L): After breakfast, you will navigate once again along the Cuyabeno river towards the Kichwa Indian Community, where your naturalist guide will explain the culture and traditions of the native people, from the past to the present. Then, you will travel by canoe down the river back to the Cuyabeno Bridge from where you will take a bus to return to Quito. You will be back in Quito at around 10:30 PM. Accommodation in Hotel Ikala Quito or similar.

COTOPAXI MOUNTAINBIKING (B, L): On this day, a guide will pick you up to go to the Cotopaxi National Park. This is about 2 hours driving from Quito. You will go to 3.800 meters to the park entrance and you can go mountain biking and hiking. Accommodation in Hotel Ikala Quito or similar.

QUITO – SAN CRISTOBAL – FREE AFTERNOON (B) Today you will arrive to the airport of San Cristobal, one of the Galapagos Islands. You will be picked up at the airport and transferred by private transport with an English speaking contact person to your hotel in the town Puerto Baquerizo Moreno. The rest of the afternoon is free to explore the town, or walk to the interpretation center, the beaches or Tijeretas. Accommodation in Galapagos Eco Friendly or similar.

KICKER ROCK (B, L): Today you will have a day tour to Kicker Rock, your first activity in the Galapagos Multisport adventure. Here you will be able to spot different shark species (sometimes even hammerheads!), turtles, rays, and more. In some seasons you might encounter jellyfish which can sting, however a wetsuit will be provided when this is the case. After snorkeling you will continue to Manglecito or a similar beach. This white coral beach offers the opportunity to walk around and relax and swim in shallow waters before returning to Puerto Baquerizo Moreno. You will have a box lunch on board. Accommodation in Galapagos Eco Friendly or similar. * It is also possible to dive at Kicker Rock (two immersion) if you have your PADI certificate (+ $ 80) including equipment.

SAN CRISTOBAL PADDLE BOARDING – BOAT TO SANTA CRUZ (B, L): In the morning you will have a paddle boarding excursion around Playa Mann. Here you will sea lions and it is the perfect way of disconnecting. After this sporty activity you have time to go to the Loberia or Tijeretas by yourself (small hikes of about 20 minutes). In the afternoon at 3 PM you take the public speedboat to Puerto Ayora, where you will arrive around 5.30 PM. Accommodation in Hotel Coloma or similar

SANTA FE (B, BL): After breakfast you will travel to Santa Fe Island. Geologically, it is one of the oldest islands in the archipelago. After a 45 minute boat ride, you will arrive to the bay of Santa Fe. There you will have a very nice snorkeling activity, if you are lucky, you can spot some birds on the rocks. After snorkeling, you will go to Playa Escondida or Garrapatero in Santa Cruz island and have a wet landing there, where you will have approximately 1 hour to discover the beach and after you go back on board and you will have your lunch. Accommodation in Hotel Coloma or similar * This tour is called ´Pesca Vivencial´ which means that you might be able to experience a fishing demonstration according to weather and park regulations. * Wet landing: It means that the boat gets close to the beach and from there you will disembark in the see, it is recommended that you bring extra clothing, as you might get wet.

BOAT TO ISABELA – KAYAK PUERTO VILLAMIL (B): Early in the morning you go by public speedboat to Isabela (about 2,5 hours). Here you will be brought to your hotel to drop off your luggage and afterwards you will go kayaking in Puerto Villamil (about 2 hours). The rest of the day you can enjoy the beach, go hiking to the “Wall of Tears” or visit the Flamingo Lagoon. Accommodation in Hotel San Vicente or similar.

SNORKELING IN LOS TÚNELES (B): About 45 minutes by boat from the dock of Puerto Villamil you will find Los Tuneles. Together with your bilingual guide you will walk through this incredible landscape and you will have the opportunity to see blue footed boobies, sea lions, penguins and the landscapes. Then you will head to El Finado, just 10 minutes from Los Tuneles. El Finado is one of the most spectacular places for snorkeling in Isabela as the water is shallow, clear and calm, giving us chance to see sea horses, parrot fish, hog fish, wrasses, in their mysterious habitat. In the early afternoon you will return to Puerto Villamil. Accommodation in Hotel San Vicente or similar

TRANSFER OUT – BALTRA (B): Early in the morning you take the public speedboat back to Puerto Ayora (2,5 hours), from there you take a taxi to the canal of Itabaca (45 min), you take the ferry (10 min) and the bus (10 min) before you get to Baltra Airport (GPS). There you take a flight back to Quito. In Quito you will be taken to your hotel by your English speaking guide. Accommodation in Hotel Ikala Quito or similar.

LOCAL MARKET – QUILOTOA LAKE – TIGUA COMMUNITY (B, L): In the early morning, you will be picked up by a guide to go to Quilotoa. But first you will visit a local indigenous market. Then you will begin your hike down the lake to explore the shore with its vegetation and views. Then you will hike back up and you will have a lunch. After lunch, you will visit a local Tigua community for their art, before you will be brought back to Quito. Accommodation in Hotel Ikala Quito or similar.
AIRPORT TRANSFER (B): Today you will have a transfer back to the airport with an English speaking driver. End of services

generalInfo:
Immerse yourself in Ecuador's steamy cloud forest, towering Andes mountains, and majestic Galapagos Islands on a privately-guided outdoor adventure...

- Hike for three days through the indigenous markets and villages of Otavalo

- Stay in a peaceful cloud forest eco-lodge, with optional river tubing, ziplining and horse riding

- Take in the views of snow-capped Cotopaxi Volcano from a cosy lodge offering mountain biking, horse riding, and guided treks

- Explore three Galapagos Islands, with hiking, biking, kayaking and snorkelling all included whilst you meet the archipelago's iconic wildlife

The exact itinerary can be tailormade to your own needs, wants, interests and timeframes, but we think this is a great example to start from.

dayInfo.description: Quito - After being welcomed at the airport and taken by private car to your boutique hotel, you have time at leisure to rest, relax, and acclimatise. The following day we take a walking tour of the UNESCO-listed colonial centre, with optional cultural activities afterwards such as a cooking class, chocolate tour, or visits to artisanal workshops.

Cloud Forest - Journey approx 2 hours out of Quito into the lush and magical cloud forest, staying at charming small eco lodge on the banks of a babbling river and surrounded by protected forest. The area is known for world class birdwatching and nature walks, but also offers optional river tubing, zip lining, horse riding and wild swimming for the active traveller.

Otavalo - Moving up into the mountainous Otavalo region, we start three days of stunning hikes amongst indigenous villages and shimmering lakes. Day 1 is a beautiful walk around the deep blue Cuicocha crater lake. Day 2 we hike between our two lodges, via the colourful indigenous craft markets of Otavalo and the workshop of a renowned traditional 'Master Weaver'. The final day is a hike to another valley with differing cultures, finishing with a cooking class in the home kitchen of a friendly local family.

Cotopaxi - Driving south towards Cotopaxi National Park, we check-in for two nights at a charming mountain lodge featuring stunning views of the iconic snow-covered volcano that gives the park its name. Your time here is at leisure to arrange guided horse riding, mountain biking or treks with the lodge, or set out into the national park by foot yourself for some independent adventures.

Santa Cruz Island, Galapagos - We return to Quito airport and fly to one of the worlds greatest outdoor destinations, the Galapagos Islands. Settle in to your hotel, from where you can walk or cycle to nearby beaches or visit the Charles Darwin Research Station. The next day we take a private boat excursion to one of the neighbouring islands, to walk and snorkel amongst the iconic wildlife that makes the Galapagos so special.

Isabela Island, Galapagos - Reached by an exhilarating speedboat journey, Isabela Island offers a quieter version of the Galapagos. Our time here includes opportunities for kayaking and snorkeling amongst reef sharks, sea turtles and penguins, and a stunning full day trek up and around the rim of the mighty Sierra Negra volcanic crater. Each afternoon we return to our boutique hotel on a gorgeous white sand beach, perfect for relaxing and taking in the amazing sights of the Galapagos.
Depart - Time to wave goodbye to this incredible country, as we head back to the mainland to connect with your flight home.

generalInfo:
This unique tour explores both the mainland of Ecuador (the cloud forests and Amazon) and the Galapagos Islands in search of some of the countries wonderful reptile and amphibian species.

During this specialist herpetological photography tour you will be in expert hands of our expert wildlife biologists and award-winning wildlife photographers who have discovered, described some of the species we aim to see and have written all of the books on the subject.

This trip will have you travelling into the mysterious cloud-forests of Mindo and the Choco and on into the lush rainforests of the Amazon in search of some of the 1,050 plus species of reptiles and amphibians known from Ecuador.

After visiting the cloud forests and Amazon on the Ecuadorian mainland and hopefully finding and photographing at least 100 different species of reptiles and amphibians you will have an immersive and action-packed seven-day adventure on the storied and breathtaking Galapagos Islands.

Introduction:
Throughout the itinerary you'll be accompanied by expert full time guides, often including: professional herpetologists and wildlife photographers, English speaking local naturalists and a local driver for all transfers. Being in the company of a naturalist is the best way to learn more about rainforest ecology and animal behaviour and will help you identify different species and interpret behaviours.
Each location and habitat visited on this tour is unique and home to a set of wildlife different from the next.
Some of the wildlife targeted is very specific to certain regions, some of the frogs, vipers and anoles are known from only one valley or patch of cloud forest and there is such an incredible diversity that anyone interested in amphibians and reptiles will have an incredible time looking for, finding and photographing some of the world's rarest species.
Ecuador is home to one of the highest concentrations of life and one of the highest biodiversities in the world. We aim to see as many species as possible and provide a great overview of the wildlife and ecosystems of Ecuador and on this specialist wildlife photography holiday.

Price Includes:

Everything mentioned in the itinerary is included. Including three meals per day (breakfast, lunch and dinner where mentioned). There will be filtered or boiled water available for each guest each day. We have our own private AC vehicles with an excellent driver for all vehicular transfers. You will have a local cultural and naturalist guides. The guides have spent years in Ecuador and know the places and wildlife and cultural monuments and sites intimately. A comprehensive species list (which states the relative chances of seeing animals based on past tours) is included in the pre-departure pack. In the Galapagos snrokelling equipment will be provided by the boat. There is also a reference book library available for your use throughout the trip as well as some documentaries on the wildlife that you are likely to see which are available to watch throughout the tour (subject to availability of a zoologist guide).

Seasons:

We choose the northern hemipshere spring as a good time for this itinerary, however there is never really a bad time of year as the locations are on the equator and so the weather is fairly constant.

Why Choose this Tour:

• All of our wildlife watching holidays are guided by an experienced herpetologists, wildlife photographers, local naturalist or guides as well as local drivers and also scientists or researchers where possible, this not only gives you numerous sets of trained eyes to find the animals but also gives you the chance to understand the behaviours and habits of the wildlife you’re watching.
• Our zoologist (where available - if you wish to have a zoologist please contact us and we can check availability - not all tours include a zoologist) that escorts tours (where available) has a great wealth of knowledge.
• Your specialist herpetologists guides are world renown and have discovered and described many new species (including some of which we will see) and have also written most of the books and field guides on Ecuadorean herpetafauna.
• We can also offer further wildlife watching activities if they present themselves whilst on the trip. For example our local guides keep their ears to the ground and have many contacts and if and when a new location of animal is known and reliably seen we can head there to experience it.
• When in the Galapagos Islands the boat will provide snorkelling equipment and their own expert naturalist onboard will work with your herping guides.
• This specific wildlife tour is one of the few in the world that explores remote and wilderness areas of Ecuador in the company of expert guides.
• We provide camera traps for you to set up and you are free to use any and all of the photographs and videos that this camera trap gets during your stay.
• All the above reasons give this, our unique Ecuador& Galapagos Herping Photo Holiday a great success rate of seeing rare wildlife. We also have the ability to organise and run wildlife tours of Ecuador which explore other areas and focus on other species such as scuba diving in the Galapagos and more specific birding holidays as well as many other species. Please inform us if you wish to receive more information about any of these locations and booking a safari.
• Unlike many tour operators we are willing to run this tour for a single person (on request).

Locations:

This tour visits a number of sights including the cloud forests and the upper Amazon rainforest. The locations within the cloud forest and Amazon are largely secret as they are study sites and home to some of the rarest species in the country. From the mainland you will fly to the iconic and famous Galapagos Islands archipelago. You will visit several of the islands as you look for the endemic reptile life here.

Fitness Level:

The fitness level required for our Ecuador herping photo tour is not too high, all wildlife is seen from walking and there are some hills (especially in the cloud forest), we recommend people are used to walking for 2-3 hours in the wet, humid and hot conditions. There is optional (but highly recommended) snorkelling on the Galapagos Islands also.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; the equipment list will vary from tour to tour and from location to location so it is best to contact us or wait until you receive the pre-departure pack after booking. We can also include specialist equipment on request such as camera traps, infrared cameras, thermal imaging equipment and spotlights. .

Minimum Age: 15 Years Old
