We'll find out how to make 'chicha', a traditional drink found in different forms throughout Ecuador, made from fermented cassava - definitely an acquired taste!

dayInfo.title: Travel to Banos and drive the 'waterfall route' to the Pailon del Diablo falls
dayInfo.description: : We'll cross back into the highlands today as we leave the Amazon Jungle behind us, driving to the town of Banos. Sitting below the active Tungarahua volcano, the lively town is a beacon for adventure and a common jumping-off point for travellers heading into the jungle. In the late afternoon, we'll drive along the 'Avenue of the Waterfalls' road, a route that takes in almost a dozen waterfalls along the Andean landscape. The Pailon del Diablo ('Cauldron of the Devil' in Spanish) is our final destination, an 80-metre drop into a swirling bowl. We'll see the falls up close before returning to Banos.

dayInfo.title: Visit Chimborazo Forest Reserve; continue to Riobamba
dayInfo.description: : Mount Chimborazo is, at 6,310 metres, the most distant point from the centre of the earth. We'll see Ecuador's highest peak today as we journey to Alausi via the Chimborazo Forest Reserve. This protected area is home to a wide variety of vegetation and animals, including alpacas and vicunas. Once in the reserve, we'll drive up to the 'Hermanos Carrel Refuge' located at 4,800 metres. This will be the highest point on our trip and will give us spectacular panoramic views across the Ecuadorian Andes. After taking in the scenery we continue our drive to Riobamba, where we'll stay overnight.

dayInfo.title: Visit the indigenous community of Palacio Real and the Inca ruins of Ingapirca before continuing to Cuenca
dayInfo.description: : We begin the day with a beautiful visit to the Palacio Real community, at the foot of the Chimborazo Volcano. It's here in Ecuador's heartlands that indigenous farming communities thrive, and the 80 families who make up Palacio Real breed llamas that are used for farming both here and around the rest of the country. They have built this into a grassroots community tourism project by welcoming visitors to the village with walks on the trails around the remote community, a visit to their small 'Museum of Llamas', and of course the chance to be surrounded by these wonderful animals in their natural habitat. Visiting another Indigenous community is an interesting counterpoint to those that we've encountered in the Amazon and the northern Andes around Otavalo. It really gives us an idea of the very distinct differences that exist between indigenous groups even within a relatively small country. Our trip continues south along the scenic Pan-American Highway with a stop in Ingapirca, the main Inca complex in Ecuador. We'll visit its principal archaeological sites before continuing to Cuenca.

dayInfo.title: Explore Cuenca on foot; visit the Diez de Agosto food market
dayInfo.description: : The UNESCO World Heritage city of Cuenca is much calmer, less sprawling and frenetic than Quito, with a beautiful historical area and central market, including two cathedrals. The city has a proud intellectual tradition that has produced many notable writers, poets, artists, and philosophers, and the city's universities are some of the best in the country. It's a beautiful city to explore, and we plan to visit the various historical parts of the city, as well as the massive Diez de Agosto food market. We'll also drive out to El Turi, which is a panoramic viewpoint in the Andean foothills, with impressive views over the peaceful city. After driving back into the city, we have a free afternoon. The city streets are atmospheric, with several small museums and markets to enjoy, as well as a whole host of cafes, restaurants and bars. You could also take a taxi to the nearby thermal pools found in Banos, just 8 kilometres/5 miles out of the city, and relax in the hot baths.

dayInfo.title: Free time in Cuenca; fly to Quito
dayInfo.description: : Today, we have a free day in Cuenca, which you might like to spend at the markets, shopping for last-minute souvenirs; or climbing up the spires of the cathedral after visiting one of the city's museums. The direct flights to Quito are in the evening, so we'll have a couple of day rooms available at the hotel for our use before we depart for the airport and fly back to Quito.

dayInfo.title: Trip ends in Quito
dayInfo.description: : The trip ends after breakfast at our hotel in Tumbaco, Quito. There are no activities planned today, so you're free to depart from Quito at any time. If your flight is departing later in the day, luggage storage facilities are available at our hotel. If you'd like an airport transfer today, you need to depart from Quito's Mariscal Sucre International Airport (UIO), which is around a 20-minute drive from our hotel.

generalInfo:
Experience the breathtaking valleys and vistas around the Avenue of Volcanoes by horseback, stay in gorgeous haciendas and get involved with Ecuadorian conservation & culture.

Haciendas by Horseback is a specialised tour of Ecuador's highlands, or Sierra region, where pathways have been carved into the landscape by Spanish settlers, Incas, and Native communities throughout history. Follow these fabled pathways on an epic adventure perfect for families who are keen on invigorating outdoor activities in the world's most dramatic countryside. Explore unseen valleys, volcanic crevices filled with verdant water, and get involved in wildlife conservation projects along the way.

Your journey will begin in the stunning historic centre of Quito, with a couple of days to explore and learn about cultural practices here - particularly making chocolate! From here, stop at Otavalo's famous markets on the way to your working hacienda (previously the home of former president Mr. Galo Plaza Lasso) at the foot of the valley. Enjoy peace and serenity, and make the most of the resident Zuleteño horses and artisan cheese before setting off following the Avenue of Volcanoes south.

You will be introduced to chagras and with their skill and knowledge, this generous community will be your local guides to these widely undiscovered lands. Wrap up in ponchos and saddle up on your journey too Cotopaxi National Park - overlooked by South America's most conical peak.
Throughout your stay in each of our hand-picked lodges you will be welcomed in as family. These are Ecuador's finest stays with world-class hospitality and locations that will make you pinch yourself in disbelief. Our daily activities range from relaxing in verdant grounds and milking cows, to trekking and challenging yourself to long rides on ancient old paths.

dayInfo.description: Welcome to Ecuador! Today you'll arrive on your international flight into Ecuador's highland capital city - Quito. Our travel representative, local to the area, will be ready to transfer you straight into this beautiful city's historic centre. Your accommodation, Hotel Casona de la Ronda, you will feel as you are entering Ecuadorian history. "Unique Boutique Hotel located in one of the oldest houses in Spain called "Las Corralas", originally built in 1738 in the Historic Center of Quito" The rooms have been designed to provide an authentic stay that reflects the true atmosphere of Quito's unique colonial center. The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of major attractions.

Cobblestones & Culture - Following breakfast you will head off to explore Ecuador's capital city with our expert guide. Starting in Quito's colonial centre, where narrow cobblestone streets are lined with whitewashed walls. This is said to be the best preserved colonial centre in all of South America, and the United Nations declared Quito as the first capital city with protected world heritage status. Walking through the Main Plaza, the Government Palace will be pointed out, La Compañia and some of the most important Baroque-style churches built around the 16th and 17th centuries, including the grand San Francisco Monastery. Walk up La Ronda Street whilst learning about traditional work in Quito all the way to the Panecillo. From the hill that dominates the south of the city, admire the famous statue of Our Lady of the Panecillo and enjoy spectacular views of Quito. After a spot of lunch, get ready for afternoon tea in the form of locally grown chocolate. Ecuador's unique equatorial climate provides the perfect environment for growing the world's finest cocoa - Cacao Arriba. Cocoa has been revered in Latin America for over 5,000 years, and the Spanish explorers adored it so much they called it the 'Food of the Gods'.

Otavalo Indian Hues - This morning you will be picked up by your driver for a journey north on the Pan-American highway to Otavalo market. On the way, you'll stop off at the Quitsato Sundile located at La Mitad Del Mundo to learn about the astronomical aspects and Cosmo's vision of prehispanic cultures that have historically lived on this land. At the market, under the watchful gaze of the majestic Mount Imbabura, you'll find a peaceful atmosphere in this Quichwa-speaking region. The town's famous craft market is one of the most visited sites in Ecuador, and with good reason. This afternoon your driver will take you to the Cotacachi-Cayapas ecological reserve for a visit to the interpretation centre with panoramic views of Cuicocha Lagoon. This deep-blue crater lake on the southern flanks of Mount Cotacachi is very picturesque, with stunning views. In the early evening, just in time for sunset, you'll arrive at Hacienda Zuleta, this amazing place will be your home for the next few days.

Condor Project - Horseback riding - Following a breakfast alfresco in Hacienda Zuleta's grounds, set off for a two-hour hike in the spectacular Andean mountain scenery to the hacienda's condor reintroduction project, stopping along the way to see some pre-Inca mounds. The hacienda is a 4,000-acre working farm with general agriculture, forestation and dairy farming operations taking place daily. When you return, saddle up and choose a route from one of the many surrounding Zuleta. Horse-riding at Zuleta is a fantastic way to spend afternoons or mornings, as they have their own breed of horses called Zuleteños for every level. You'll be provided with helmets, half chaps, rain ponchos and a saddle bag, so you can feel entirely at ease whilst exploring the glorious horse trails surrounding you. There are six hours' worth of routes just outside your hacienda's door. You'll be provided with lunch, generous snacks and refreshing drinks to keep you going along the way.

Life on a Working Farm - We encourage you to spend this morning riding and exploring the truly spectacular scenery that surrounds you. Hacienda Zuleta will also host a tour of the cheese museum, where you may learn how to make 14 different types of fresh, semi-aged and aged cheeses. Each variety is handmade here with local milk by people from the local community with Zuleta spirit! Visit the organic gardens, feed baby calves, count sheep, talk to the vaqueros and enjoy the embroidery museum. This truly is a countryside idyll.

Set Off and Saddle Up - Today after a hearty breakfast, you'll travel further south to Hacienda La Alegría in Machachi. The journey will take just under three hours, but it will be an incredibly scenic drive as you traverse the mountain range. La Alegría is a warm lodge that celebrates the traditions and customs of the local chagras - the highland people. In goat-skin chaps and woolen ponchos, these people welcome tourists and demonstrate their centuries-old techniques for herding cattle. The skill on horseback and knowledge of Andean paramo surrounding are nothing short of legendary, and it is with this insight that you'll be introduced to the land. This is where your proper riding excursions begin, with the chagras as your inspiration for the journey, you'll explore the grasslands framed by ancient volcanoes, highland plateaus, and rivers that flow down the Andes all the way to the Amazon. Today you will meet the horses on the hacienda, try on the equipment and practice a little with the chosen horse. Nestle in for nights by the hacienda's roaring fire and eat delicious Ecuadorian food. Rest well in humungous beds before your onward excursions in days to follow.

Riding up to the Mountain Chain - After a healthy breakfast, we will cross the Lagchig gorge, which is the beginning of the hundred-year-old canal that reaches La Alegría. You will be able to observe different landscapes and ecosystems due to the ravines, gorges, waterfalls, and forests that we will encounter along the way.

Around the Widow Mountain - After a healthy breakfast, we will ascend to 3600 meters and we will be able to observe the Machachi valley and the Avenue of the Volcanoes. We ride around the mountain and descend to the valley, then arrive at Hacienda La Alegria for lunch. When we reach the western part of the Viudita mountain, we take a narrow path through a paramo. This paramo suddenly changes to become a forest of local bamboo (zuro) where you can see forest turkeys and other bird species. We ride around the mountain enjoying views of the cloud forest, the south of the city of Quito, and the nine volcanoes. The vegetation and endemic trees such as the pumamaqui, guneras, and some orchids gives us the impression of a high-altitude cloud forest. The route is subject to the weather conditions.

Cotopaxi National Park - This morning canter through the mountains and bid farewell to this special setting as soon you'll head off to Cotopaxi National Park. As you drive towards the park, take in the spectacular view of snowcapped summits of the Cotopaxi and Antisana volcanoes. Visit the Interpretation Centre to learn about the history of this spectacular volcano's major eruptions, as well as the unique local flora and fauna. You'll be escorted to Laguna de Limpiopungo and stretch your legs around beautiful surroundings mirrored in the deep blue waters. For those who are looking to be more adventurous, two-hour hike will take you to Mount Cotopaxis J. Ribas refuge at 4,800 meters above sea level, where you will be blown away by the spectacular views of the volcanoes and surrounding Andean peaks before ending at Chilcabamba Mountain Lodge. This lodge is traditional Andean setting with the rooms overlooking the epic mountain range and volcanoes.

Quilotoa Lagoon & Tigua Painting - After a delicious breakfast, set off to explore the surrounding markets, which are as authentic as it gets. These are the centres of the local indigenous people's social and economic worlds. Following a morning exploring, you'll visit the Quilotoa volcano crater, where you'll be stunned by the crater's serenely mysterious green lake. As you encircle the crater's rim, condors will soar above and deer in the grasslands around you. On the way back, visit the art galleries in Tigua, where paintings representative of the folklore of this special part of the Andes are showcased. The brightly coloured style of the painters - currently the third generation - has transcended local boundaries and is now internationally renowned. These days there are a lot of painters in Tigua, but Julio Toaquiza was the first and is still number one. You'll meet Julio in his studio to see and understand why his vibrant work is so highly appreciated - for the level of meticulous detail and the stories that the paintings bring to life. This evening, dream of the volcanoes, the condors, and the indigenous community's world-famous legends.

Unique Horse Trails - Chilcabamba Mountain Lodge offers unique horse ride trail options, which uncover quieter areas of Cotopaxi National Park. Meet with the chagras in their colourful clothes and set off towards Cotopaxi and Ruminahui, chasing those amazing views.

A romantic departure - After breakfast, and on your way back to the airport, you'll stop off at a world-class rose producer's garden in full bloom. Ecuadorian roses are recognised as being some of the finest in the world; they are exported absolutely everywhere. This farm produces unique, beautiful, multicoloured roses for the most discerning customers. You will be shown the process of producing high-quality roses and explain the research that has gone into producing the flowers' marvellous colours. Many products created by this beautiful blossom are also available to enjoy and sample, such as rose honey, sea salt, vinegar, chocolate and marmalade. Sadly, your flight will be waiting to take you back home after your epic journey in Ecuador's lesser-seen highland regions.

placesVisited: Quito, Condor Rescue Park, Otavalo, Papallacta hot springs, Andes and Amazon, Baños, Cotopaxi volcano, Guamote, Cookery class, Nariz del Diablo train, Ingapirca ruins, Cuenca, National Park Cajas, Optional outdoor activities, Guayaquil
generalInfo:
If you enjoy the freedom of the open road and the chance to explore a country independently, but without the hassle of trip planning and with the knowledge that someone is on hand to help at all times, then this self-drive holiday is the perfect way to see Ecuador. Offering some of the world’s most scenic road trips, from the high peaks of the Andes to the leafy foliage of the Amazon, this is the ideal destination for adventurous travellers.

This 14 day tour is tailor made to suit your dream itinerary and, while we provide you with a route and ideas for places to stop along the way, the only they you “have” to do is reach your hotel by the end of the day. You are provided with a car, usually a Suzuki Grand Vitara SZ or similar, and, as Ecuador travel experts, we offer you a list of “hidden treasures”, including restaurants, animal rescue centres and local artisans. But ultimately, where and how often you stop, as well as where you eat, is all up to you.

The route proposed takes in many of Ecuador’s highlights, from cities and cultural experiences to magnificent landscapes and wildlife. From the capital city Quito to the colourful houses in the port city of Guayaquil, you’ll enjoy the many views from the beautiful haciendas and eco-lodges you stay in along the way. Or, if you prefer a different route or alternative arrangements, we can customise a travel plan to suit you.

dayInfo.description: ARRIVAL QUITO After your arrival in Quito Airport, an English speaking driver will pick you up to bring you to your hotel, which is located in the center of Quito. Accommodation in Hotel Cruz Loma or similar.

CITY TOUR QUITO – EQUATOR (B, L): After having breakfast, you will explore the beautiful center of Quito through a city tour. Afterwards, you will visit the equator with private transport and also get the chance to see the highlights of Quito, like El Panecillo, La Basilica, La Ronda and the Pululahua crater. Later, you’ll enjoy a typical local lunch and can relax the rest of the day or explore the city by yourself. Accommodation in Hotel Cruz Loma or similar.

CAYAMBE – LAGO SAN PABLO – CONDOR PARK – OTAVALO (B): Today, your actual “self-drive” starts. You will be brought to the car rental parking lot from where you will pick up your car (Suzuki Grand Vitara SZ or similar). We recommend a certain route with nice stops but the only thing you “have” to do is to get to the Hacienda at the end of the day. The number of stops, how to get there, where to eat is all your decision. The first stop will be at the Cayambe, where there is a nice local Bizcochos factory. Then, you will go to Lago San Pablo, where you can enjoy beautiful views. Afterwards, you will visit the Condor Rescue Park. The owner Joep, who is Dutch is committed to the preservation of the condors in the Andes. Twice a day, there is an air show with the condors (except on Mondays and Tuesdays). Later, you will drive to Otavalo where on Saturdays there is a big native market with different kinds of handicrafts. In addition, there is also an animal market. You can also visit the beautiful lake of Cuicocha and do a hike there. The town of Cotacachi is also a nice place to visit; you can find here a lot of artisans that make the most beautiful leather products. Accommodation in Hacienda Cusin or similar

OTAVALO – PAPALLACTA (B): After your breakfast, you can visit the surroundings of Lago San Pablo and Otavalo before you head to Papallacta. On the way to Papallacta, you will find a lot of flower farms for roses. In the afternoon, you will visit the hot springs and enjoy the beautiful view there. You can also do some self – guided hikes. Accommodation in Spa Hotel Papallacta or similar.

ANDES MOUNTAINS – AMAZON (B, D): Today you will drive from the high Andes mountains to the Amazon. After approximately 3 hours driving you will arrive at the sub-tropic climate of the Amazon. It is interesting to see how the vegetation changes in the different regions. Just before arriving to Tena you find a charming eco-lodge along the river. Accommodation in Hakuna Matata or similar.

AMAZON (B, L, D): On this day, you will stay at Hakuna Matata and enjoy the beautiful atmosphere of the Amazon. You can also enjoy the swimming pool, swim in the river, go by car to Tena or arrange an excursion with the lodge. Accommodation in Hakuna Matata Eco-Lodge.

BANOS – WATERFALLS – PUYO (B): After having a large breakfast, you will drive from Tena to Baños de Aqua Santa through the waterfalls trail. Along the way, you can make several stops for a small hike and pictures. Close to that is an animal rescue center in Puyo (Tarqui) where Amazon animals are picked up by a local family. Additionally, in the evening Baños is very entertaining with several restaurants and bars. Accommodation in Samari Spa Resort or similar

COTOPAXI VOLCANO (B): Today, you will drive about 3 hours from Baños to the Cotopaxi volcano. You can not enter the park without a local guide, but you can always hire the guide locally. The National Park entrance policies change regularly and Rebecca Adventure Travel is not responsible for any extra fees or other restrictions. (+ $ 40 p.p) Accommodation in Hacienda Papagayo Sur or similar

CHIMBORAZO –GUAMOTE MARKET – LOCAL ACTIVITIES (B): After breakfast, you will drive to the southern part of Ecuador. After about 4 hours driving you will arrive in Guamote. Along the way, you will have beautiful views of the highest volcano in Ecuador, Chimborazo. In Guamote, you will stay at Inti Sisa, where there are a lot of social projects organized by the Indian community. In the afternoon, you will have cooking class from the cook of Inti Sisa. Every Thursday, there is a famous market in Guamote. From the surrounding communities high in the Andes, thousands of indigenous people come together to buy and sell their goods. Accommodation in Inti Sisa or similar.

NARIZ DEL DIABLO TRAIN – INGAPIRCA RUINS (B): Today you will drive towards the south of the country. You can make a stop at Aluisi to visit the Nariz del Diablo train (journey time approximately 45 minutes). After this, you can drive to the Ingapirca ruins (journey time approximately 45 minutes). Accommodation in Posada Ingapirca or similar

INGAPIRCA – CUENCA (B): Today you will drive to Cuenca which takes about 1.5 hours. When you arrive in Cuenca you can visit the mirador, walk around the Historical centre and discover the villages around. There is also a very nice spa on about 20 minutes driving. Accommodation in Hotel Victoria or similar

CUENCA – NATIONAL PARK CAJAS (B): After having breakfast, you will visit the center of Cuenca and the National Park Cajas. There is a beautiful hacienda where you will stay the night. Accommodation in Hacienda Dos Chorreras or similar

HACIENDA LA DANESA – GUAYAQUIL (B, L): Today you will drive from Cuenca to Guayaquil. After about 2,5 hours, you will arrive at Hacienda la Danesa, a very beautiful house where you will have lunch. Besides, you can decide between several optional activities, like horseback riding, tubing, mountain biking or hiking (Except horseback riding, the activities are included). Additionally, it is possible to follow a workshop cocoa or to learn milking cows. From La Danesa you drive to Guayaquil where you would have to hand in your car. The last night night you will stay in Guayaquil and you can enjoy the rich cuisine that this city has to offer. Accommodation in Hotel Wyndham Guayaquil or similar
FLIGHT BACK HOME (B): Today, you will be brought to the airport with an airport shuttle to catch your flight back home. Another option would be to extend your stay at the Galapagos Islands.

generalInfo: Explore the wonders of Ecuador's diverse landscapes with an unforgettable adventure that spans the Amazon Rainforest, majestic Andes Mountains, and vibrant cultural sites. This captivating tour offers breathtaking views, wildlife encounters, and immersive cultural experiences. Hike through lush rainforests, visit traditional Andean villages, and marvel at the stunning Cotopaxi Volcano. Ideal for nature lovers and culture enthusiasts, this journey promises a unique blend of ecological discovery and rich heritage in one of the world's most biodiverse countries.

dayInfo.description: Quito, Ecuador: Arrival Day Arrive in Quito and immerse yourself in its vibrant energy! If you land early, take advantage of the chance to discover the city's captivating streets and bustling markets at your leisure. Delve into its storied past, savor the local flavors, and absorb the lively ambiance while awaiting the arrival of your fellow travelers. Keep in mind that your hotel is near the airport, so if you're keen on exploring the city, consider arranging transportation, as it's not included. Later, come together for an orientation meeting filled with excitement and anticipation as you meet your fellow adventurers, setting the tone for an unforgettable journey ahead.

Quito - Yunguilla, Ecuador: Get ready for an exhilarating adventure as your private transport swiftly takes you to downtown Quito! Prepare to be amazed by the Historic Center's stunning architecture, a true gem of Latin American colonial culture. With our lively happiness leader leading the way, soak in the sights of iconic landmarks like the Basilica del Voto, Iglesia de la Compañía de Jesús, and Plaza Grande. Take a leisurely stroll along La Ronda, immersing yourself in the rich history of one of Quito's oldest streets. But the fun doesn't end there! After your exciting walking tour, get ready for a mind-blowing experience at the Intiñan Museum, where gravity-defying experiments await. From balancing an egg on a nail to watching water spin in opposite directions, these unique exhibits will spark your curiosity. Then, it's time for Yunguilla, where adventure and community await. Feel the warmth of their extended family as you dive into their daily life or embark on a scenic hike. Get ready for an unforgettable overnight stay, ensuring you savor every moment of the full Yunguilla experience.

Yunguilla - Tena, Ecuador: Rise and shine for an immersive morning in the community, engaging in activities before breakfast. Afterward, embark on a journey to Tena, with a captivating stop at Amupakin. Delve into the rich Kiwcha tradition, rooted in a quest for intercultural healthcare recognition. Experience the healing power of Kichwa ancestral medicine, deeply intertwined with nature and spiritual wisdom. Continue your Amazon adventure upon arrival at the lodge dock. Receive a warm welcome from the staff before unwinding in the lounge with a refreshing tropical snack. Gather for a briefing by our knowledgeable guides, offering insights into accommodation and activities. *Note: the itinerary is subject to change, according the weather conditions or the availability in the lodge

Tena, Ecuador: Fuel up with breakfast before embarking on a thrilling trek through the secondary forest, lasting 2.5 to 3 hours. In the afternoon, dive into cultural immersion as an Amazonian Kichwa community graciously welcomes us. Witness their unique way of life and profound connection with the jungle, unveiling a hidden part of the Amazon rarely seen on maps. Join in the tradition of preparing and tasting "chicha," a beloved fermented yucca drink, and savor traditional dishes. Delight in the opportunity to support the indigenous community by purchasing handmade crafts, contributing to their livelihoods.

Tena - Banos, Ecuador: Begin your day with a hearty breakfast before embarking on a journey to the charming town of Baños. Along the way, make a meaningful stop at Yanacocha, a rescue center dedicated to preserving the biodiversity of the tropical forest. Witness their vital efforts to rescue and rehabilitate wild animals, and learn about their mission to educate communities on wildlife conservation.Upon arrival in Baños, dive into the vibrant culture with a lively salsa lesson. Then, enjoy a leisurely afternoon exploring the town at your own pace.

Banos, Ecuador: Start your day with a delicious breakfast at your accommodation. Then, indulge in leisure time to explore the enchanting town of Baños at your own pace or opt for one of our exciting tours. O PTIONAL ACTIVITIES : For thrill-seekers, embark on the thrilling Canopy and Bridge Experience, featuring zip lines, a Tibetan bridge, and rock climbing above the river. Afterward, enjoy the afternoon off to partake in a variety of activities, from visiting the iconic "Casa del Arbol" swing for breathtaking views to rafting, hiking, canyoning, or unwinding at nearby hot springs. As evening descends, join a shared tour aboard the traditional Chiva transport to a viewpoint for a mesmerizing nocturnal vista of the city. Later, embrace the nightlife of Baños on your own for an unforgettable evening adventure.

Banos - Quilotoa, Ecuador: After savoring a delightful breakfast at our accommodation, we'll embark on an unforgettable journey to the Quilotoa Lagoon, a mesmerizing volcanic crater lake known for its striking greenish hue. Delve into free time to hike down into the crater or explore its rim, soaking in panoramic views from various angles. Later, we'll visit a studio in Tigua renowned for its vibrant and intricate artwork, offering insight into the area's rich cultural heritage. OPTIONAL ACTIVITIES : Experience the thrill of kayaking on the stunning Lake Quilotoa, where you can paddle through the crystal-clear waters and soak in the breathtaking views of this volcanic-crater lake. (This activity will arrange locally directly paid to the community cost about 10 pp)

Quilotoa - Quito, Ecuador: Today we will start the day early and head towards the Cotopaxi, which is with its 5897m considered one of the highest active volcanoes in the world. The first stop will be the entrance of the national park to register your entry and use restrooms in case you need them. We will get off the bus at the parking lot on the Cotopaxi and start to hike up towards the refuge José Róse, located at 4864m. It is a smooth hike, yet it takes some time to adjust to the height. Upon arrival at the refuge, we will take a break and enjoy the great view. Afterward, we will return to the parking place, from where the downhill cycling towards the preserved area of the Limpiopungo Lagoon starts (optional). Arriving at the lagoon, you have some time to rest and take pictures of the stunning nature. Afterward, the whole group will reach the Hacienda, where we will enjoy a late lunch. The rest of the day you will have free time, to discover the beautiful surroundings of the Hacienda, or just relax in the cozy rooms. In the evening we will enjoy dinner together. Overnight in Quito near to the airport
Quito, Ecuador: On this last day, you will be taken to the Quito Airport on time to catch your flight back home.

generalInfo: Ecuador has an embarrassment of riches when it comes to natural wonders and indigenous cultures and this itinerary will showcase the very best of each. Explore the three main habitats on mainland Ecuador: the cloud forest, high Andes and of course the Amazon jungle, where you will also spend time with Amazonian communities that have chosen tourism over the money they could make selling their land to oil companies. This is the very best of one of Latin America's true gems.

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival into Quito airport, you will be met by one of our representatives and taken to your hotel in Quito old town to check-in and relax.
Today is free for you to explore this UNESCO World Heritage City. If you prefer we can arrange a guide to help you explore. (B)
After a delicious breakfast lunch you will take the relatively short drive north to a beautiful cloud forest, where you will spend the next few days surrounded by trees and bird life. (B/L/D)

Wake to the sounds of the forest nice and early and go on a guided hike to spot some of the incredible array of bird life that calls this reserve home. Spend the rest of the day exploring with a guide or on your own. (B/L/D)
You will have another chance to explore the forest today before transferring back to Quito for the afternoon. (B/L/D)
Fly into the Amazon and transfer by boat to your Jungle Lodge. We work closely with a few lodges to cover most budgets however they all offer the most incredible Amazon experience! (B/D)
You will explore the Amazon jungle on foot and by canoe and take part in some of the activities run by the lodge and local communities, such as piranha fishing and night walks. (B/L/D)
One last morning under the big green canopy before making your way by boat and plane back to Quito. (B/L)

Your journey now turns south as you drive to the wide open spaces of Cotopaxi National Park, filled with tropical flowers, beautiful mountain lakes and, of course, the stunning Cotopaxi volcano. Once you reach your lodge you can relax and stroll among the beautiful scenery, or we can arrange hikes or horseriding for you. (B)
Spend the morning horse riding alongside the local cowboys and pass the afternoon however you like. (B)
Leave Cotopaxi as you travel across the valley to the insanely beautiful crater lake of Quilotoa. Hike around the rim before heading back to Quito for your last night. (B/L/D)
We'll take you to the airport in time for your international flight, taking home lots of wonderful memories of Ecuador. (B)

placesVisited: Quito, Andean cloud forest, Visit to indigenous community, Otavalo, Andean highlands and rainforest, Baños, Cotopaxi National Park and volcano, Santa Cruz Island, Charles Darwin Research Centre, North Seymour Island, Bachas Island, Plazas South Island, Bartolomé Island, Isla Santa Fe.
generalInfo:
This two-week itinerary has been carefully crafted to create the perfect, tailor-made holiday itinerary for families and mixed generational groups. It captures some of the most exciting aspects of Ecuador’s cloud forest, Andean landscapes and people, and, of course, the Galapagos Islands. Ecuador is a haven for adventure, wildlife watching and cultural wonders. It is also a very small country, making holidays very accessible for families who don’t want too much time on the road. Within a few days you can travel from the UNESCO World heritage capital Quito, meet people from fascinating indigenous communities, haggle at a market, and walk and swim in the cloud forest.

And then there is the whole other world of the Galapagos Islands, in the water and on land. Swim with sea lions or sea turtles and get up close to iguanas and giant tortoises - just part of the extraordinary wildlife and fun, from dawn until dusk. Water features heavily on the mainland, too - in Ecuador’s mountain rivers and waterfalls. The itinerary is tailor made and so we can adapt it to suit your family’s needs and interests, whether they want more adrenalin filled adventure, or tranquil wildlife watching. Ecuador and the Galapagos holidays really do offer it all, and even though there is so much to do in two weeks, you will never feel rushed. This is family time after all.

dayInfo.description: Arrival at Quito airport and transfer to your hotel. Overnight in a 3* hotel.

Quito tour, afternoon Teleferiqo (B) Your journey begins with a visit to the capital of Ecuador. It is located at 2,850 metres above sea level, at the slopes of the Pichincha volcano and nestled in a green Andean valley. Quito, one of the oldest cities in South America, is also one of the few cities that has preserved numerous monuments and artistic treasures of the Spanish colonial period.The colonial centre of the city was declared a UNESCO World Heritage site in 1978. We begin the tour with a walk through the narrow streets to visit some of America's oldest and most beautiful churches such as El Sagrario and La Compañia and the famous plazas of Santo Domingo, La Merced and San Francisco. Today you explore the beautiful historical centre of Quito with its wonderful squares and picturesque churches. We have lunch at a local restaurant and in the afternoon will take the teleferico up to a viewpoint on the slopes of Pichincha volcano. The views from up here are wonderful and the kids will enjoy the adventure. There is even a small amusement park at its base. Return to our hotel

Equator visit, Otavalo, Hacienda Chorlavi (B,L,D) This morning we travel north to explore the region around Otavalo. Enroute we stop at the Quitsato Museum with its unique sun-dial, located exactly on the Equator line. Great photo opportunity as you hop from hemisphere to hemisphere. We then take a short walk along the rim of the stunning Cuicocha Volcano, with its captivating blue-green crater lake enjoying more fabulous views to the waters and mountains around. In the afternoon we visit the famous colourful indigenous market in Otavalo – souvenirs! Haggle with the friendly stallholders over Andean weavings, silver and many other beautiful items. Having bought some lovely souvenirs or perhaps just enjoyed an ice-cream and the views, we head to Hacienda Chorlavi. This traditional hacienda has been in the hands of the Tobar family for six generations and is a great base for travelling with children. It has ample space, lovely gardens (with hammocks), a heated pool and play areas such as a play park and a bicycle course. Plenty to keep the children happy during our time here.

Peguche Waterfalls, Andean Musicians, Condors (B,L,D). We explore Peguche and go for an easy walk to the local waterfall, before visiting the home of a family of musicians where we learn more about typical Andean musical instruments, such as panpipes. We have lunch at a local restaurant and continue to the Condor Park, a rescue centre for Andean birds where we can see and learn more about Ecuadorian wildlife and see the stunning condors up close.

Pahuma reserve and Maquipucuna Cloud Forest Lodge (B,L,D). We rise early today and venture further, into the lush cloud forest region of Ecuador. In Pahuma we can take a short walk through the cloud forest looking for hummingbirds, orchids and hidden waterfalls. Picnic lunch. In the afternoon we arrive at the Maquipucuna Cloud Forest Reserve. The lodge is set in the cloud forest and attracts large numbers of hummingbirds which you can watch from the communal areas while you enjoy a cool drink. A night walk can be enjoyed after dinner to explore the forest after dark.

Cloud forest walk, waterfall swim, Maquipucuna (B,L,D) We explore the forest on foot with our guide and learn about the wildlife and uses of plants. After a tasty lunch we don our bathing suits and head to a nearby waterfall for a dip in the refreshingly cool natural pool.

Trail walk, swim, return to Quito (B,L) After breakfast, we’ll set off on a gentle walk along the Wetlands Trail, stopping at various swimming holes along the river for a refreshing dip. We’ll return to the lodge along the Main Trail. After lunch, bid farewell to the countryside and return to Quito to prepare for the next chapter of your adventure—the Galapagos Islands!

Galapagos, visit to Charles Darwin Research Centre (B,L) It's usually a fairly early start, and we pick you up from your hotel and head to the airport. Having completed the formalities (luggage checks), it's a flight to the remote Galapagos Islands. On arrival in Baltra, Galapagos, your local guide will meet you for your transfer to Puerto Ayora. Lunch in a local restaurant. This afternoon we visit the Charles Darwin Research Centre. We reach the Centre after a 15-minute walk. Along the trail there is a Galápagos National Park information booth where we need to register. While walking around the research centre we will be able to observe different species of giant tortoises and land iguanas that live on the islands of Santa Cruz, Española, Santiago and Pinzón. The species were brought here to conduct a captive breeding program with the aim of repopulating areas that have been adversely affected in the past. Drop off at your hotel, evening free to explore the town and eat in one of the local restaurants. NOTE: We can tailor make a Galapagos Islands itinerary if you wish for different activities/islands).

Bay tour and snorkel. Afternoon ferry to Isabela, transfer to hotel. (B) This morning’s shared tour starts from the principal dock in Puerto Ayora. We will visit several points of interest by boat including Caamaño Islet, which has a sea lion colony, where if climate conditions permit we can snorkel. At Franklin Bay we are on the look-out for endemic vegetation and can snorkel for sure. We disembark for a short walk to Los Perros Beach, passed the Love Canal and Shark Canal. This afternoon we take the speed boat to Isabela. Firstly, we need to pass through the SICGAL inspection booth, where they check to mak e sure organic substances are not transported between islands. Once we have passed the inspection, we will board a water taxi which transfers us to the speed boat that takes us to Isabela Island. The boat ride takes approximately 2 hours. On arrival in Puerto Villamil transfer in to your hotel. Evening free to explore the small town and restaurants.

Sierra Negra Volcano walk and Tortoise Farm. (B,L) This morning you will be picked up from your hotel around 7am for your shared tour to the Sierra Negra Volcano. After around 45 minutes driving you will get to a place called “El Cura” from where you will start hiking on the eastern flanks of the caldera of the Sierra Negra Volcano to a place called "Los Jaboncillos". Here we take a break and enjoy a little briefing about the volcano before we start the second part of the hike into Chico Volcano. The Sierra Negra Volcano is considered the most ancient of all of Isabela’s volcanoes. Its caldera is 10 km in diameter and it is the second largest in the world (the largest being Tgorontgoro in Tanzania). The Sierra Negra Volcano rises to an altitude of 1500m. Box lunch included, today’s tour takes around 5 hours. Afternoon visit to Giant Tortoise Farm.

Free day. (B) Isabela is perfect for a free day; enjoy the beach, hire bikes, kayak, walk or just relax. Some tours can be booked up locally, while others are subject to availability. Tuneles (Tunnels) and Tintoreras are two we recommend pre-booking, which we can book for you (not included in price).

Ferry to Santa Cruz, transfer to hotel. (B) We wave goodbye to Isabela today (you can stay longer) and take the ferry back to Santa Cruz (early morning or early afternoon departures). Once back in Santa Cruz, we take you to your hotel and you have free time. Places of interest include the Highlands, or Tortuga Bay or perhaps some souvenir shopping.

Transfer to airport, fly to mainland, trip ends or add extra nights. (B) We take you back to Baltra airport for your flight back to mainland Ecuador – Quito or Guayaquil – and you can connect to an evening flight home (please check with us beforehand) or add extra nights. Please note: This trip is an outline and can be tailor-made to suit your preferences and ages of children.

placesVisited: Quito, Amazon, Napo Wildlife Centre, Piranha fishing, Night walks, Otavalo, Cotopaxi National Park, Optional: hikes or horse riding, Riobamba, Ride the Devil's Nose Train, Ingapirca, Cajas National Park, Cuenca, Guayaquil
generalInfo: Spend 11 days enjoying some of Ecuador’s most beautiful landscapes and sights, learning about its different cultures and meeting its people on this Ecuador tailor made holiday. Spend two nights in the capital Quito before flying to the beautiful Amazon rainforest. Here, you can explore by canoe or by walking, enjoy activities such as piranha fishing and learn first hand about life in the Amazon from the communities living here. Next, from the Amazon to the Andes, as you head to Cotopaxi National Park to see the spectacular Avenue of the Volcanoes. You can hike, horse ride or simply relax here. You’ll also visit quiet old towns including Riobamba, Otavalo and Cuenca, ride the Devil's Nose train – an amazing engineering feat – explore Cajas National Park, see Inca ruins and shop in busy markets. It's a superb introduction to this fascinating, beautiful country.

dayInfo.description: Fly into the Amazon and transfer by boat to the Napo Culture Centre. We work closely with a few different lodges to cover most budgets, all offering incredible Amazon experiences. (B/D)

Fly back to Quito where you will be met and taken north to visit the colourful town of Otavalo. The town's famous market is a fantastic place to buy presents and experience the capital of Ecuador's indigenous heartland. (B/D)

Your journey now turns south as you drive to the wide open spaces of Cotopaxi National Park, filled with tropical flowers, beautiful mountain lakes and, of course, the stunning Cotopaxi volcano. Once you reach your lodge you can relax and stroll among the beautiful scenery, or we can arrange hikes or horse riding for you. (B/L/D)

Continue your exploration of the High Andes as you drive to the town of Riobamba. Situated at the base of the mighty Chimborazo Volcano, the highest peak in Ecuador, Riobamba is a lovely town in which to spend the afternoon, meandering through the old colonial streets. (B/L)

Today is a real treat! Spend the day on the breath-taking Devil's Nose Train, one of the greatest feats of engineering in the world, as it traverses up an almost sheer cliff. Afterwards continue on to Ecuador's most important Inca site, Ingapirca. where you can explore before staying in the local posada for the night. (B/L)

Today you will visit Cajas National Park, before heading to the stunning colonial town of Cuenca. The scenery of Cajas is one of major attractions of the area and includes tundra-like flora and hundreds of crystal blue lakes, providing spectacular hiking opportunities through remote areas. Cuenca is a wonderful town to explore on foot in the afternoon, with its amazing network of beautiful old colonial buildings and streets. (B)

In the morning you will be taken to Guayaquil to catch your international flight home or a domestic flight to Quito. If you have time you can explore the old port of Ecuador’s second city before catching your flight. (B)

placesVisited: Tours of Quito's historic district and local markets, Guided nature walk in Maquipucuna cloud forest, Wildlife watching tour in the Amazon, Napo Wildlife Centre, Parrot Clay Lick Observatory, Canoe trip on the Napo River, Sacha Wildlife Centre, Canoe tours through Amazon swamps and mangroves
generalInfo:
Travel into the depths of the Amazonian Rainforest in Ecuador and come face to face with giant otters, river dolphins, dozens of monkeys and possibly the elusive jaguar. This wildlife tour is definitely going to be one to remember.

Throughout the itinerary suggested below you'll be accompanied by expert full time guides, often including: English speaking local guides and a local driver for all transfers. Being in the company of a naturalist guide is the best way to learn more about rainforest ecology and animal behaviour and will help you identify different species and interpret behaviours. For example there are very subtle differences between some of the small primate species, such as marmosets, and many people see mixed foraging groups of primates without ever knowing the difference.

Ecuador is home to one of the highest concentrations of life and one of the highest biodiversities in the world. Wildlife rich Andean cloud forests and Amazon rainforest are literally teeming with life and different species. The numbers of animals and plants in Ecuador is truly mind blowing, with over half of all South American birds and twice as many species that live in Europe; there are also more mammals per-square-metre than anywhere else on earth.

During the proposed itinerary below (which can be amended and tailored to suit your ideal requirements) you will be taken to three of the best wildlife watching lodges in the world, two in the famous Amazon rainforest and one in the stunning cloud forest. The main focus of this tour will be tracking some of the more elusive mammals, such as: spectacled bears, giant otters, Brazilian tapirs, dozens of primate species and maybe even a puma, jaguar, ocelot or jaguarondi.

The outlined itinerary below can be undertaken at any time of the year. The climate in Ecuador is remarkably stable (being right on the equator) however we recommend the months from August to November as spectacled bears come out of hiding to take advantage of fruiting trees.

Fitness Level:
There is a fair amount of walking involved in this tour, but it is all on pathways and not excessively taxing. There are no strenuous activities included and guests can decide on how much or how little they wish to commit to.

Equipment:

When you book onto the tour we will send you a comprehensive pre-departure pack which will include a full packing list of recommended equipment; but as a rule of thumb we recommend you bring along your own binoculars or spotting scope (although scopes are not great in the dense rainforest) as well as appropriate clothing; which should be everything from swimming gear and light and airy hot weather clothing to warm underwear and waterproofs for the cloud forests. The nights up in the cloud forests can be chilly so a fleece, long trousers and woolly hat are a good idea. Comfortable walking shoes are a must. Insect repellent is needed. Any medication, books or other items of a personal nature is of course up to you to bring along. Oh and please bring plenty of memory cards or film for your camera. Also do not forget sun cream, sun hat and sun glasses as the sun can be very strong here during the day.

Minimum age: 18 Years old

dayInfo.description: Quito – Arrival – On arrival in Quito you will meet your local guide and be transferred to your accommodation. This evening there will be a small night tour of the city of Quito and the historic centre. A nice welcome will be offered in a traditional restaurant of the city, where you will be briefed on the rest of the tour. (No meals included today).

Quito & Mintel del Mundo – Sightseeing– This morning will be an early start by going to one of Quito’s local markets; this is a very local experience, where “caseras” offer products on small kiosks that are filled with an incredible variety of Ecuador’s local fruits and vegetables. We will then visit the Mitad del Mundo Monument where one step can take you from one hemisphere to another as you straddle the equator. After lunch we will visit the historic centre of Quito, which is considered one of the best preserved colonial sites in Latin America. We will visit incredible churches like the Compañia de Jesus Church, the Basilica del Voto Nacional and San Francisco Plaza. (Breakfast only)

Cloud Forest – Wildlife Watching – Early this morning you will be picked up from your hotel and start your trip through the Andean Hills and into the cloud forest. We will stop off at the Pululahua Geobotanic Reserve, which is in fact a volcano which has people living inside and a place called Utopia (because when Fundación Maquipucuna began his work of conservation 20 years ago, everything looked like a dream). After around two hours of driving we will arrive to Maquipucuna Ecotourism Centre. There will be some time for relaxing and getting prepared for your first guided walk into the cloud forest. Maquipucuna is home of 350 species of orchids, 370 bird species, 50 species of mammals, countless species of invertebrates and exotic species of butterflies and moths so you will not be disappointed. There is the possibility of setting up camera traps to see what animals have been moving around after dark here as well. When you arrive back at the lodge you will have lunch before visiting the orchid garden organic farm in the afternoon. (Breakfast & Dinner included)

Cloud forest. Wildlife Watching – Once again this morning, you will rise early to view some of the birds as they start their day around the lodge. Tanagers, Toucans and Euphonies are the main targets. This is the best time of day to spot Spectacled Bears and if their favourite fruit is ripe when we arrive (the time changes every year), you will probably see one. Although they are very hard to see anywhere, they are more regularly seen here than anywhere else. After breakfast, you will have another guided walk around the reserve before starting the journey back to Quito. (Breakfast & Dinner included).

Napo Wildlife Centre, Amazon – Wildlife Watching - This morning you will be taken from your hotel in Quito to the airport to catch the short flight to Coca. Upon arriving in the Amazon, a short local bus journey will take us to Port Francisco de Orellana where you will take a guided canoe along one of the many rivers and towards Napo. Along the waterways, Herons and Kingfishers are among the commonly seen animals. Once you have got to Napo there will be another short canoe trip along the narrow creeks to Anangu Lake where the lodge is located. Various large birds like Toucans, Parrots and even Macaws can be seen. After dark and your evening meal, you can spend some time spotlighting for the many Caiman that inhabit the lake. Whilst out after dark you never know what other mammals will come down to the lake shore for a drink and it is always worth looking out for jaguars. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included)

Sacha Wildlife Centre, Amazon – Wildlife Watching – This morning, you will once again take a flight into the Amazon Rainforest. After a 2-hour canoe ride, a short hike will bring you to a different lake and Sacha Lodge. Lake Pilchicocha is very inviting and we recommend a good old dip once you arrive here to relax after your day of travelling. You can also visit the mini observation tower, which allows for fantastic views at sunset and is also a great place to view many of the common birds seen around the lodge. There is also a butterfly house here where a local guide will help introduce you to the outstanding colours and shapes of the butterflies in the rainforest. After dark and your evening meal, you can either have a guided walk or canoe ride after dark to spotlight for nocturnal animals including Caiman. (Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included).

Otovalo – Sightseeing – Today will be another early start as we catch the flight back to Quito. Once we arrive back in the capital you will have a great little trip; you will try some local biscuits from a small factory in Cayambe overlooking the stunning San Pablo Lake as well as continuing to one of the biggest markets along the famous Pan-American Highway which spans the Andes: Otavalo. This is an active crater that has filled with water over hundreds of years and here you will enjoy your last evening meal in Ecuador, overlooking the crater before you return to your Quito. (Breakfast only).
Home – Departure - This morning you will be transferred to the airport so you can catch your return flight home. (Breakfast only)

generalInfo:
This Galapagos Islands vacation is flexible and fits your schedule and budget. Depart any day you want year round, and choose a four-eight-day itinerary option. It’s perfect for couples, families and small groups! You travel from island to island by speed boat and stay in idyllic beach or waterfront hotels on two islands. You see all the classic Galapagos wildlife and enjoy a variety of activities including snorkeling, walking and hiking. Trips are led by Galapagos National Park Service certified guides as well as a local tour leader.

You may not like the idea of being wedded to a cruise boat for a week and this is an excellent alternative. Fact is that for years the only way to explore the Galapagos Islands was by traveling on a yacht or cruise ship that carried from ten to a hundred people. Today you have a choice and on this trip we connect the islands with speed boats that travel much faster than the larger yachts and cruise ships. Our “Flexible Galapagos” trip is the most seamless of these adventures. We have been operating tours in the Galapagos since 2005 and are very pleased to bring you this exclusive and alternative Galapagos tour.

Highlights of this Galapagos Islands vacation include learning in-depth about the Galapagos ecosystems as you walk and explore the islands; a hike to the still-active Sierra Negra volcano on the island of Isabela and; amazing wildlife interactions. You watch blue-footed boobies fly and dive; see marine iguanas slumber along or jump into the water and; observe brown pelicans fishing and being challenged by frigate birds for their food. You also swim and play with frolicking young sea lions. At the end of each activity-filled day, gaze upon spectacular sunsets and soak in the magical web of life that is the Galapagos.

There are four small towns on the Galapagos and about 20,000 people living in the islands. On this land-based tour you fully explore this dimension of the Galapagos ecosystem. You stay in small hotels run by local people, dine in local restaurants, travel by various forms of local transport and in the end gain a much fuller understanding and appreciation for life and evolution in the islands. This tour represents the best in sustainable tourism to the Galapagos because of the many and varied local services it supports. While a very small percentage of the fees paid for traditional cruise programs stay in the islands, this land-based Galapagos Islands tour leaves a significant economic impact. There is also a much smaller contribution to the planet’s carbon emissions as little time is spent traveling by boat and much more time is spent walking and exploring under your own power.

dayInfo.description: Baltra + Santa Cruz - Fly into Baltra Island where your Galapagos Islands journey begins, with one of our guides meeting you at the airport. Then head to neighboring Santa Cruz to visit a private reserve where Galapagos giant tortoises roam free. Wander alongside these immense creatures as they munch on their greens while learning about their unique lifestyle. We will then visit a lava tunnel to discover the powerful volcanic forces that have shaped the archipelago. In the mid-afternoon, we’ll check into our lodgings in Puerto Ayora, the busiest settlement in the Galapagos Islands. Dinner will be enjoyed along the Calle de los Kioskos, which is lined with alfresco eateries for a distinctly local Galapagos experience. Accommodations: Hotel Maineo or Hotel Posada del Mar. Meals Included: Lunch, Dinner.

Santa Cruz + Isabela Today begins with a visit to the white sands of Tortuga Bay where you can spot lava lizards, marine iguanas, and blue-footed boobies. You can relax on the mangrove- fringed beaches, wander through the cacti forest, or enjoy a swim alongside the friendly baby sharks. There is also the opportunity to go boogie boarding or surfing but please advise your guide in advance if you’re interested in these activities. We’ll spend as long as you like at Tortuga Bay before returning to Puerto Ayora to visit the Charles Darwin Research Station. It offers a fascinating insight into the conservation work being done on the islands, as well as being home to giant tortoises at all stages of growth. Aside from seeing unhatched eggs and centenarian adults, you can observe playful babies in action. After lunch, we’ll jump on a boat to the largest island in the Galapagos, Isabela, and begin our exploration with a stroll through Puerto Villamil. In the evening, we’ll watch as the sun sets over the Pacific Ocean from a nearby beach before returning to town for dinner. Accommodations: Hotel Albermarle or Casa de Marita. Meals Included: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner.

Isabela - After breakfast, we’ll embark on a hike up one of the Galapagos’ most active volcanoes, Sierra Negra. Marvel at its surreal landscapes while keeping an eye out for vermillion flycatchers and rare short-eared owls. After reaching the caldera, we’ll hike around the rim and continue through the lunar-like landscapes that lead to Volcan Chico. From here, there are panoramic views across the north of Isabela Island. In the early afternoon, we will return to Puerto Villamil where you’ll have a choice of activities at your disposal. You can go kayaking to spot sea lions, Galapagos penguins, and frigate birds on the surrounding shores or rent a bike to visit the historic Wall of Tears built by Isabela’s former inmates. Dinner is at a restaurant of your choice in Puerto Villamil, with your guide always available for recommendations. Accommodations: Hotel Albermarle or Casa de Marita. Meals Included: Breakfast, lunch.

Isabela + San Cristobal - We’ll begin the day with an easy walk to spot pink flamingos feeding in the shallow waters of a mangrove-fringed lagoon. Our path leads to Isabela’s Giant Tortoise Breeding Center, which plays an important role in bringing the island’s reptiles back from the brink of extinction. It’s another wonderful opportunity to see Galapagos giant tortoises at various stages of growth and learn what it takes to return them to the wild. In the afternoon, we’ll board a flight to San Cristobal, the easternmost of the Galapagos Islands. Our first destination is La Loberia, which is famed for its sea lions who frolic in and out of the surrounding waters. If you desire, you can hop in to swim alongside them. Dinner is at a restaurant of your choice in Puerto Baquerizo Moreno. Accommodations: Hotel Casa Blanca. Meals Included: Breakfast, lunch.

San Cristobal - Your final full day in the Galapagos Islands begins with a visit to Kicker Rock, which is also known as “Leon Dormido” after its resemblance to a sleeping lion. You’ll have the opportunity to snorkel in a narrow channel formed by two volcanic rocks where sea turtles, spotted eagle rays and a variety of tropical fish congregate. Galapagos and hammerhead sharks are also occasionally spotted here while the islands’ rocky terrain provides a nesting site for blue-footed boobies and frigate birds. Our boat will continue to a white sandy beach where we’ll relax over lunch before another optional snorkeling session. We’ll return to town by late afternoon, just in time for a sunset cocktail or a short bike exploration before our farewell dinner at an alfresco restaurant. Accommodations: Hotel Casa Blanca. Meals Included: Breakfast, lunch.

Departure - After breakfast, enjoy a final swim in the Galapagos Islands, pay a visit to the Interpretation Centre, or hike to Tijeretas before flying back to mainland Ecuador to begin your journey home. Meals Included: Breakfast.

generalInfo:
This 4-day tour highlights the natural beauty and ecological richness of Santa Cruz Island in the Galapagos. You’ll explore the world-renowned Charles Darwin Research Station, where giant tortoises are part of important conservation efforts, and gain insight into the unique biodiversity of the archipelago.

Highland excursions on Santa Cruz will take you through lush vegetation and volcanic landscapes, where you may encounter iconic species like land iguanas, Darwin’s finches, and the famous giant tortoises in their natural environment.
Your journey continues with day trips to Bartolome and North Seymour, two nearby islands known for their dramatic scenery and abundant wildlife. On Bartolome, admire its iconic pinnacle rock and panoramic views. On North Seymour, walk among blue-footed boobies, frigatebirds, and playful sea lions in one of the best wildlife observation spots in the Galapagos.


This itinerary is perfect for nature lovers seeking an immersive experience. It offers a balanced combination of land and marine exploration, close encounters with endemic wildlife, and the chance to witness some of the most breathtaking views the Galapagos has to offer.

dayInfo.description: Quito/Guayaquil - Baltra - Puerto Ayora. Fly from Quito, Guayaquil or Quito to Baltra airport. A naturalist guide will take you to Puerto Ayora. The guide will stop on the way to see the highlands, and giant land tortoises. You can enjoy the views and have lunch here. After lunch, you'll continue the transfer back to your hotel. The guide will bring you to Tortuga Bay in the afternoon. You walk through a cactus path for about 45 minutes to reach the first beach. It is known as Playa Brava because of its strong currents. You will see many marine iguanas and marine birds on this beach. We continue our walk for 15 minutes after visiting Playa Brava to reach Playa Mansa. The second beach, Playa Mansa, is surrounded by wetlands frequented by pelicans and blue-footed boobies. This is a great place to relax and swim. The distance you walk to get back to your hotel to eat and stay is the same. It is important that you choose a flight early enough to arrive at Baltra by 10am. Meals Included: Lunch / Dinner

Navigation (Bartolome, North Seymour or Santa Fe) Today, we will only be visiting one island. The tour begins after breakfast when the guide meets you at your hotel to start the tour. The yacht is equipped with a small, comfortable lunch. Return to the port after our tour concludes in the afternoon. North Seymour Island offers a beautiful place for hiking and snorkeling. The main attractions include: boobies (also known as booby birds), gulls (also called hawks), green sea turtles, and the famous Galapagos Sharks. Bartolome Island, too, is the most beautiful island in the archipelago. It is the most photographed island in the Galapagos Islands. Two beautiful bays, as well as fascinating volcanic cones and lava formations can be seen. Two islands form Plazas. The contrast between the turquoise water and the black lava, white sand is an excellent place to observe marine life. The coasts are the perfect place for snorkeling. Santa Fe Island, also known as Barrington Island, after Samuel Barrington is a small island of 24 square kilometers (9.3 square miles) in the Galapagos Archipelago. It lies to the south-east of Santa Cruz Island. It is also one of the oldest geologically, as volcanic rocks dating back to 4 million years have been discovered. The island's vegetation is characterized by brush and palo santo, as well as stands of a variety of prickly pears cactus Opuntia echios. We will then return to our hotel for dinner and accommodation. The island will be selected based on the available space Meals Included: Breakfast / Lunch / Dinner

Santa Cruz - Baltra Charles Station is visited in the early morning. You will be able to see different species of Tortoises. You will learn and hear about the conservation efforts aimed at protecting the Giant, as well as the entire archipelago. The guide and you will then take the road to the airport. This takes about an hour. You will then take a flight to Quito, or Guayaquil. It is important that you choose a flight departing Baltra no earlier than 11am to execute this itinerary. Meals Included: Breakfast

generalInfo:
Explore the Galapagos, either the virtually untouched western end of the Galapagos Islands, which has just been born out of fire, or a shorter route that gives an excellent impression of this unique ‘laboratory of evolution’ in case you have less time, or if you are on a limited budget.

Uncover the mystery of how tough pioneer species make barren lava fields habitable; and approach bizarre outgrowths of adaptation as marine iguanas and flightless cormorants. It’s true that accessing this remote and isolated region demands longer navigation (mainly overnight), but our stable mega-catamaran enables you to witness ‘survival of the fittest’, without experiencing it.

Our vessel has just 9 cabins, all with balconies, and is designed specifically for cruising the Galapagos Islands. The vessel is a stable & wide motor catamaran with the comfort of a floating hotel. All cabins are spacious & bright and have a private balcony & sea view.

Our vessel was launched in 2009 and completely refurbished in 2024.

INCLUSIONS
Lodging on board in a cabin with private facilities
All meals, water, coffee and tea
All excursions as mentioned in the itinerary (itinerary subject to change) with English speaking naturalist guide.
Snorkeling gear (masks, flippers and snorkel).

dayInfo.description: Spend 5-7 days cruising the Galapagos Islands and exploring some of the main sites or more remote locations. Some of the highlights: Fernandina is the third largest island in the archipelago and has a single visitor site: Punta Espinoza located at the nor theastern tip of the island. Marine iguanas conglomerate in larger groups than in any other island. They bask around in the sand, swim near the shore and sometime block the way at the landing dock. Among the unique species found here, is the Flightless Cormorant. This bird had to adjust its way of survival and perfection its skills of finding food in the ocean. Their wings, tails and feet progressively adapted for swimming. To see these birds, is to witness evolution happening right in front of you. Tagus Cove (Isabela) A tour along the cliffs in a zodiac will give the visitors a good chance to see the Galapagos penguin, the flightless cormorant and other sea birds. From the landing dock it is about a 30 minute hike along the trail up to the top of the cliff from where you can view Darwin Lake, an uplifted ultra-saline lake saltier than the sea. You can also see several volcanoes from this location. Look carefully at the graffiti on the surrounding cliffs of the cove, it has been written by pirates, whalers and buccaneers in past centuries. Rabida After a wet landing on the remarkable red beach of Rábida, there are two short guided walks. Iron oxide particles give rocks and sand their reddish color. The beach wall has a shallow lagoon fringed with green; This oasis is the most fertile spot on the otherwise barren islet, which is covered in palo santo trees. The salty lagoon attracts all kinds of waterfowl, including pintails and sometimes red flamingos. Many species of songbirds hide and breed among the evergreen foliage of the surrounding mangroves. One of the most outstanding attractions is the important breeding colony of brown pelicans, the only pelicans in the world that dive. Las Bachas Beach (Santa Cruz) These two small beaches are located to the west of Black Turtle Cove, in Santa Cruz. Its sand consists of decomposed corals, which makes it white and soft. This makes it a favorite nesting site for sea turtles. Behind one of the beaches there are small lagoons, where flamingos and other shore birds, such as Galapagos gulls and lapwings, can be seen from time to time. On the second beach, which is the widest, you can explore the remains of two abandoned warships. In World War II, these were left behind by the US, as the island of Baltra was used as a strategic point for the protection of the Panama Canal. The name Las Bachas originated at this time, since the word with which the North Americans called these two boats, “barges”, was difficult for the local inhabitants to pronounce and they ended up making it Spanish. Eden Islet El Eden is a paradisiacal tuff cone islet, just off the west coast of Santa Cruz (between Whale Bay and Dragon Hill). This morning we will disembark to the appropriately named Eden Islet. On its coast you will observe land iguanas and sea lions soaking up the sun, as well as seabirds feeding in the nearby mangrove forests. It is a perfect location for swimming activities, as the clear and calm waters will allow you to snorkel along tropical fish, rays, and two species of sharks. Alternatively, a kayak ride would be a memorable experience. Dragon Hill (Santa Cruz) The visitor site at Dragon Hill has been open for visits since 1993. This site is located in north-western Santa Cruz Island and consists of a trail that lead to a hyper-saline lagoon behind the beach, frequented by flamingos, pintail ducks and other species of birds. This site has been re populated with land iguanas from Seymour, Isabela and Santa Cruz islands. There is a short walk to the Hill, which offers a beautiful view of the bay.

placesVisited: Guided tour of Santa Cruz, Charles Darwin Research Centre, Punta Cormorant flamingo lagoon, Snorkeling off Floreana Island, Post Office Bay, Punta Suarez, Walking tour of Isla Lobos, Cerro Colorado Tortoise Centre, Seymour
generalInfo:
Get up close and personal with the wildlife that inspired Charles Darwin’s world-changing research; snorkel turtles, sharks and tropical fish; walk alongside loveable giant tortoises, and cruise from place to place aboard a fully crewed yacht. Seriously, what’s not to love about this fantastic Galapagos Islands holiday?

The 8 day south-western tour aboard the catamaran Archipel I gives you an extensive overview of the Galapagos Islands. You will have the chance to combine the circumnavigation of the Isabela Island with excursions in the most southern points of the archipelago. You will also be able to snorkel with sea lions in the Loberia and visit the Charles Darwin Research Station in Santa Cruz.

HIGHLIGHTS:
-Virgin Fernandina & isolated west coast of Isabela make you eye-witness of evolution
-Breeding programs of emblematic Galapagos giant tortoises
-Unique tidal channel with whitetip reef sharks & rays
-Not to be missed highlight South Plaza (land iguanas & giant cactus forest)

dayInfo.description: Upon arrival at San Cristobal airport you will need to pay the park entrance fee, which funds conservation work to protect the islands' biodiversity. In the afternoon you will visit the Interpretation center. The Interpretation Centre gives a perfect explanation of this unique archipelago. Information panels, pictures, documents, maquettes, and dioramas tell background and conservation stories about the extraordinary islands.(B/L/D)

AM: South Plaza: Despite its small size, some of the most interesting and outstanding species of the Galapagos are found here. There are several hybrid iguanas- a result of crossing a male marine iguana and a female land iguana. PM: Santa Fe: Santa Fe is home to a number of endemic species like the Galapagos Hawk, Galapagos snake, Galapagos mockingbird, rice rats and one of the two species of lands iguanas of the islands (B/L/D)

AM: North Seymour: North Seymour is another highlight of your cruise. In the archipelago’s most extensive seabird breeding colony you can walk just a short distance from frigatebirds and blue-footed boobies. PM: Chinese Hat: Though recently born out of the fire the volcanic islet Chinese Hat does not appear to be any more inhospitable than Bartolomé and lunatic Sullivan Bay. This tiny, rusty-coloured islet just begins to sprout. You arrive just in time to witness the next chapter about colonisation by pioneers! (B/L/D)

AM: El Chato Reserve - Twin Craters: El Chato Reserve is a protected area and official part of the Galapagos National Park. It extends from Cerro El Chato as far down as the southwestern coast of Santa Cruz Island, where females lay their eggs. PM: CC Fausto Llerena: A tour at Fausto Llerena Breeding Center you can see the tortoises of Española Island, ending in the tortoise exhibit corral. Tortoises of this corral are accustomed to humans; it is an excellent spot to be photographed with them! (B/L/D)

AM: Moreno Point (Isabela): Fresh, promising greens of pioneer vegetation contrast strongly with the dead, pitch-black lava flow that once reached the ocean at Moreno Point. PM: Elizabeth Bay (Isabela): At the remote Elizabeth Bay you will enjoy the best dinghy-ride of the Galapagos, which combines a visit to the Marielas Islets in the mouth of the bay, with the highest mangles in its innermost heart. (B/L/D)

AM: Tagus Cove (Isabela): Tagus Cove is a historical anchorage at the northern entrance of Bolivar Channel (between Isabela and Fernandina). PM: Espinoza Point (Fernandina): Westernmost Fernandina harbours one of the world’s most virgin, untouched ecosystems, and is another crown jewel of the Galapagos. (B/L/D)

AM: Puerto Egas (Santiago): Puerto Egas is historical, and the favourite site on Santiago for wildlife lovers; and it’s even the best place in the archipelago to observe Galapagos fur seals. PM: Rabida (Fernandina): Upon landing at this remarkable red beach, you will usually be greeted by a large bachelor colony of Galapagos sea lions. (B/L/D)

AM: Bachas Beach (Santa Cruz) Strolling along its coastline, the blinding white Bachas Beach appears full of natural life. It is one of most important breeding sites for Pacific green turtles. Transfer out to Baltra Airport Assisted by the naturalist guide and some crew members, the dinghy will bring you and your luggage to Baltra, where we will take the airport shuttle. Your guide will accompany you to the check-in counters in the departure hall.

tourName: Galapagos active adventure tour, land based
generalInfo:
The first and original land-based Galapagos Islands adventure tour, featured in the New York Times and winner of National Geographic "Tours of a Lifetime." This is the only Galapagos Islands tour that includes two nights of beach camping on the Galapagos Islands and is an active adventure. On this amazing wildlife trip you kayak, snorkel, hike and explore areas that cruises cannot access. Our local, expert and very knowledgeable guides enrich your Galapagos Islands holiday while you hike in the mountains, swim with sea lions and have an intimate encounter with this magical ecosystem.

Most Galapagos Islands tours are cruise-based, carrying from 10 to 100 people. This Galapagos tour, the only of its kind, allows our small groups to visit sites off the main tourist routes. And you travel in the most environmentally-friendly way imaginable - your own power. We walk and sea kayak where other more intrusive travel couldn't take us and our reward is not only what we see, but also the pleasure we have in getting there. Working closely with local fishermen, we access places that very, very few others visit. As well, we hike to the interior of the islands and a highlight is climbing to the rim of a recently active volcano. While most trips are comprised of adults, we also offer some family-specific departures of this Galapagos Islands tour.

This unique tour also provides a holistic view of the Galapagos ecosystems including the human element that is very much a part of the landscape. There are roughly 20,000 people living in the Galapagos Islands, concentrated primarily in four towns. Because we stay in small, local hotels, eat our meals at local restaurants (except during the time we are camping), use local transport and services and buy all our supplies in the islands, this trip represents the best in responsible, sustainable tourism to the Galapagos. While less than 8% of the fees you pay on a typical cruise program stay in the Galapagos, on this tour well over 30% is spent directly in the islands. Your carbon footprint is also significantly less as you are not chugging around in a boat, but rather, exploring under human power – paddling, hiking and swimming.
